loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia de 51 años es una madre muy abnegada, viuda y con un gran corazón de mujer tiene el orgullo de haber educado a sus dos hijos hoy ya mayores y convertirlos en personas con muchos valores y amor por el trabajo. Es poseedora de una vivienda construida a base de adobe.
Es propietaria de unas parcelas las cuales destino a la producción de café cuya ubicación se halla a  5 kilómetros de su localidad.
Lleva más de 30 años en el rubro y espera seguir trabajando con el entusiasmo que la caracteriza ya que siente que las fuerzas y las ganas de trabajar son lo que le sobran.
Le agrada su actividad puesto que recuerda sus mejores momentos familiares en el campo.
Para realizar sus actividades de manera fluida cuenta constantemente con el apoyo de jornaleros quienes la apoyan en las diversas actividades que forzosas ya.
Actualmente planea expandir sus plantaciones de café en la parte alta de su parcela y debe contar con plantones de café bebe  para el cual planea acudir a su entidad financiera y solicitar un préstamo con el cual financiar su próxima campaña productiva.
Tiene en mente concretar a través de su trabajo la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble.
Requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles los cuales destinará a la compra de plantas de café para expandir su producción así como la contrata de jornaleros para la respectiva tarea.
texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Lidia is a very selfless mother.  She is a widow with a big heart who is proud to have been able to have given her children, who are now grown, an education and to have made them people with values and a love of work.  She owns an adobe home.

She owns some plots of land used to grow coffee that are 5km from her home.

She has been in this business for over 30 years and she expects to keep working with her characteristic enthusiasm, as she feels she has more than enough strength and desire to keep working. 

She likes her work because she remembers her best times with her family in the fields.

In order to make sure the work goes smoothly, she always counts on the help of laborers who help her with different tasks that are too strenuous.

She is currently planning to expand her coffee plantings into the higher part of her land and she needs baby coffee saplings.  To do this, she plans to go to her financier and ask for a loan to fund her next planting season.

She is thinking about rebuilding her home with fine materials through her work.

She needs 2,000 nuevos soles to buy coffee plants to expand her production and to hire more laborers for the work.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 36 years old and married. He supports his two children aged eight and four. He offers transport services in Kapsabet and has been in operation for a period of two years earning an income of 5,000 KES monthly.

He is servicing a loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD. This is his second loan after repaying his previous loan successfully. He intends to use this money to add to his savings and purchase a new motorcycle for his business.  

The profits he gets will be used to repay back the loan. He wishes to be successful in his business and live a happy life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is forty five years old and married. She has three children; one of them is still attending school. They live in the northwest of Albania and she is involved in two agricultural activities; one is animal husbandry and the other is planting crops and veggies.
 
Lindita has been practicing both of these activities for twenty-one years now, and the income she’s been generating from both has been the only one for her family. She claims that she gets help from her husband; he takes the products to the market to sell.

Lindita wants to increase the dairy products she produces, so she wants to add another dairy cow. This would be Lindita’s first loan from VisionFund Albania.

loans.use: to add another dairy cow.

loans.name: Evancy

texts.en:
Evancy is 45 years old, married, and blessed with six children aged between 3 and 17 years old. He owns a spare parts shop and has been in the business for over eight years, earning a monthly income of 19,000 KES.  

He is now requesting his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. He intends to use this loan to purchase spare parts to sell.

The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for his schoolgoing children and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts  for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, de 43 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Félix y su hijo Jovani, al que cuida en la casa que heredó desde hace 16 años. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, desde los primeros rayos de sol se dedica la crianza de sus animales posee vacas de lecheras de buena calidad, a las que cuida con mucha dedicación ya que son delicadas, “siempre mueren de hinchazón de barriga”, afirma.  Comenta que todos los días vende los litros de leche que producen sus animales, de esa manera tiene ingresos diarios. Asimismo, como buena mujer del campo también siembra y vende comida en un espacio de su tienda de comestibles, otra de sus principales actividades económicas, hace 13 años abrió una tienda surtida con alimentos de primera necesidad por su barrio, pues no existe otra tienda igual, de esa manera puede tener un ingreso estable, además de tener clientes permanentes quienes año tras año compran sus alimentos en la tienda de Nancy. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido con el apoyo obtenido, pues de esa manera se siente tranquila de invertir, además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que en su asociación le enseñaron a ser responsable.
Nancy, invertirá el dinero en la compra de sacos de arroz y azúcar, además de cajas de leche, aceite y demás productos, asimismo una vaca lechera para aumentar su ganadería.
texts.en:
Nancy, forty-three, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband, Félix, and her son, Jovani, whom she takes care of in the house she inherited when she was sixteen.  She's a very hardworking woman; from the time the sun comes up she works at raising her animals; she has high-quality milk cows that she looks after with great dedication because they are very delicate.  "They are forever dying of colic," she says.  She says she sells liters of milk that her animals produce on a daily basis, and that's how she earns her living.

In addition, like a good farm woman, Nancy grows food and sells it in her eatery, another of her financial activities.  Thirteen years ago she opened up a store stocked up with foods that are basic necessities in her neighborhood because there aren't any other stores like hers, so she's able to make a stable income and have steady customers that buy food at her store year after year.  

This will be Nancy's eighth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support she has received because she feels comfortable investing in her business.  She promises to make her payments on time because in her group she has learned to be responsible.  She'll invest her loan in sacks of rice and sugar, as well as boxes of milk, oil and other items, and a milk cow to expand her herd.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, and boxes of milk and oil.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José tiene 41 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Él es una persona que se ha esforzado mucho para apoyar a su hijo. Él estuvo internado en un centro de rehabilitación del alcoholismo durante dos años, ahí aprendió a vender productos de bisutería, CD, DVS, ropa de todas las edades, bolsones, entre otros productos. Hoy en día tiene once años de experiencia en ese negocio y posee dos lugares en donde los vende, una de ellas es en las escuelas de la comunidad y en la zona norte del departamento en donde vive. Antes, se dedicaba a la agricultura, a sembrar granos básicos. Es muy conocido en la zona por su sociabilidad y carisma con las personas.

Él compra su mercadería cada ocho días, se traslada a la capital para realizar las compras, debido a que los adquiere a mejor precio y aborda tres autobuses hasta llegar a su destino. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar $200 de ropa de todas las edades, $150 en la compra de CD y DVD, $100 en aritos y calcomanías, productos de bisutería $250 y $250 para comprar bolsones para estudiantes. Con la inversión, dispondrá de mayor inventario para ofertar más productos a sus clientes y más en esta época en donde inician las clases. Espera que sus ventas aumenten considerablemente para que sus ingresos sean mejores y construir una vivienda más digna y adquirir un vehiculo para trasladar la mercadería de un lugar a otro más cómodamente.
texts.en:
José is forty-one and has one child.  He's a person who has really made an effort to support his child.  He was in an alcohol rehab center for two years, where he learned how to sell costume jewelry, CDs, DVDs, clothing for all ages, backpacks, etc.  He now has eleven years' experience and has two locales, one of which is by the community schools in the area north of the department where he lives.  Previously he worked in agriculture, growing basic grains.  He is very well-known in his area for his sociability and charisma.

José buys his merchandise every eight days, traveling to the capital, where he can get them for the best prices.  He takes three buses to get there.

José is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo to buy $200 in clothing for all ages, $150 in CDs and DVDs, $100 in earrings and decals, $250 in  costume jewelry, and $250 to buy backpacks for students.  With the investment he'll have plenty of inventory so he can offer more products to his clients this season and when school starts.  He hopes sales will increase considerably so he can earn more and build a more decent house and get a car to transport merchandise from one place to another more conveniently.

loans.use: to buy $200 in clothing for all ages, $150 in CDs and DVDs, $100 in earrings and decals, $250 in  costume jewelry, and $250 to buy backpacks for students.

loans.name: Mouhamed Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mohamed Abdoulaye est un jeune commerçant âgé de 28 ans seulement. Il est célibataire sans enfant et vit avec sa maman et ses sœurs. Il gère une petite quincaillerie qui est à ses débuts depuis 2 ans.IL commence sa journée à 7h et la termine à 22 h du soir. C’est lui qui s’occupe de sa mère et de ses sœurs et de leurs besoins au quotidien.
Etant donné que l’activité est naissante, il a besoin d’appui d’une institution financière comme IMCEC pour prendre un bon départ. Il a comme souhait de voir sa boutique devenir un grand magasin.
texts.en:
Mouhamed Abdoulaye is only 28 years old and involved in retail business.  He is single with no children, and lives with his mother and sisters.  For the past two years he has been running a small newly-created hardware store.  He starts his day at 7 AM and ends it at 10 PM.  He takes care of his mother and sisters and meets their daily needs.

Since his business is still new, Mouhamed Abdoulaye needs financial support from a financial institution like UIMCEC, in order to be off to a good start.  His dream is to turn his small shop into a larger store.

loans.use: to buy hardware products such as cement, plaster and small tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Clea

texts.en: Clea is the mother of six children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the food vending business for more than ten years now. Aside from that, she is also engaged in the business of raising hogs. Clea needs additional capital for the expansion of her ventures. She is requesting for a loan to buy feed for the pigs. In addition to this, she wants to buy ingredients for her food vending business: vegetables, cooking oil, seasoning, meat and others. In the future, Clea hopes to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs.

loans.name: Mouhamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mouhamadou, âgé de 60 ans, marié et père de famille, a besoin de sécuriser le lieu ou vit sa famille ; c’est pourquoi il vient solliciter un crédit de 200000F CFA afin de continuer les travaux de construction de son domicile. Avec le crédit, il va acheter du matériel de construction. Le  crédit lui permettra en quelque sorte de rénover sa maison. Seulement comme activité dans le futur, il aimerait ouvrir un magasin afin d’y vendre des produits de premières nécessités et de la friperie.
texts.en:
Mouhamadou, age 60, is married and has a family.  He needs to make his family home safer, and has therefore requested a loan of 200,000 CFA francs to proceed with the construction of his house.  He will use this loan to buy building materials.  In a way, this loan will help him to renovate his house.

In the future, he would like to open a shop and sell staple goods as well as second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build his house.

loans.name: And Liggey Group

texts.fr: L e groupe de crédit and liggey regroupe 5 personnes, membres d’une même famille dont 2 hommes et 3 femmes. Ils font du commerce, de l’élevage. La présidente, Adja Khady, mariée est âgée de 39 ans fait du commerce de tissus, sacs… Elle a une expérience de 2 ans dans ce domaine. Elle n’a pas de charges et travaille pour diversifier les produits et services et avoir un confort social.
texts.en: The And Liggey loan group has five members, two men and three women who are all from the same family. They work in retail and animal fattening. The president of the group, Adja Khady, is 39 years of age, married, and works selling fabrics and bags. She has two years' experience in this area, and has no expenses to cover. She works to diversify the products and services she offers, as well as to have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and bags for resale

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María, tiene 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Hace 10 años que María genera sus propios ingresos, tiene establecido en el mercado local su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, vende pantalones, sandalias, camisas y otros. Para mantener el negocio activo ha invertido varios préstamos, en ODEF lleva 22 ciclos de préstamos, el actual que solicita es por 28,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar calzado, camisas y pantalones para surtir el negocio. Ella espera seguir creciendo y trabajando duro para salir siempre adelante.
texts.en: Maria, 33, is married and has 3 children.  She lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  Ten years ago, Maria set up a business selling clothing and shoes in the local market so that she could generate her own income.  She sells pants, sandals, shirts, and other items.  She has been taking a number of loans to  keep her business going; she has completed 22 loan cycles in ODEF.  The loan she requests now is for 28,000 Honduran lempiras.  She will use this loan to buy shoes, shirts, and pants to stock up her business.  Maria hopes to continue to grow and work hard, so that she can continue to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy shoes, shirts and pants to sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina, de 56 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive desde hace 36 años en la casa que compró junto a su esposo Daniel y uno de los 8 hijos que tuvo: Dora. Vivir en el campo es lo que más le gusta, su actividad durante 18 años es la agricultura, cuenta que le fue muy difícil comenzar a adquirir sus terrenos agrícolas, por lo que su mamá le heredó en los que ahora siembra papa, habas, trigo, cebada y maíz. Poco a poco comenzó a ganar experiencia en la comercialización es por ello que ahora, por ejemplo, sabe que los meses de mayo a julio, llegan los comerciantes de todo el país a comprar las mejores cosechas de los distintos agricultores, por ello cuida mucho que sus cultivos sean de buena calidad, esa es la razón que sus sembríos son muy buenos y rentables. Ahora desea seguir mejorando la producción de los alimentos, pues tiene un mayor reto. Paulina también se dedica a la crianza de vacas, tiene 10 ejemplares, de las que produce leche que comercializa a los ganaderos, además del negocio de compra y venta de animales menores como ovejas, cerdos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Cruz de espinas” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, en todo estos años de trabajo, obtuvo buenos resultados en su negocio y en su vida personal, por lo que se encuentra agradecido, por ello promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, además le agrada pertenecer a su asociación, pues se apoyan y son como una familia.
Paulina, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcirlos cuando sus sembríos se encuentren creciendo.
texts.en:
Paulina, 56 years old, is a simple woman. She has lived for 36 years in the house that she bought together with her spouse Daniel and one of her 8 children: Dora. Living in the country is what she likes most. 

Her work for 18 years has been in agriculture. She says that it was very difficult for her to begin acquiring her farmland. On the land that she inherited from her mother, she now sows potatoes, beans, wheat, barley, and corn. Little by little she began to gain experience in commercialization. For that reason she now knows, for example, that in the months of May and July, merchants from all over the country arrive to buy the best harvests from different cultivators. For that reason, she cares very much that her harvests are of good quality. This is the reason why her crops are very good and profitable. Now she wishes to continue improving her production of food crops, so she has a great challenge. 

Paulina also makes a living raising cows, of which she has 10, which produce milk that she sells to ranchers. In addition she has a business buying and selling small animals such as sheep and pigs. 

She belongs to the solidarity group "Cruz de espinas" and this is their ninth loan with MFP. In all these years, she achieved good results in her business and in her personal life, for which she is grateful, and for this reason she promises to be punctual with her payments. Additionally she is grateful to belong to her association, since they support each other and are like a family.

Paulina will invest the money in the purchase of organic fertilizer to intersperse when her crops are growing.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Uzmee

texts.en: Mrs. Uzmee is a 64-year-old widow who lives with her son in a small house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her son, Monhjargal, age 30, works at a local company as an assistant worker. This borrower has been running an auto spare parts retail business in the local market since 2000. She is now planning to purchase bulk spare parts from Ulaanbaatar and sell them to local customers. She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase bulk spare parts to sell at retail prices. She has a good record with previous loan repayments without any delinquents at XacBank.

loans.use: to purchase bulk spare parts to sell at retail prices in the local market

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Getafe, Bohol. She is engaged in a printing business together with her husband. This is the source of their income. Estrella is asking for a loan to buy additional materials for printing, like paint, paintbrushes, cloth, Sharpie markers, and others. Estrella hopes to make their business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for printing, like paint, paintbrushes, cloth, Sharpie markers, and others

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en: Faustin is 26 years old. He is single. He has been in business for 5 years and has a retail store. He wants a loan to buy more food stuffs for sale. The profits from the business will increase his capital.

loans.use: to buy more food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three working siblings. The family is facing bad financial circumstances and living in unpleasant conditions. For this reason, they are all cooperating for a better, respectable future.  In 2010, he started to work as a beautician. He has a beauty shop in his town where he provides his customers with high quality beauty services. This is his first Kiva loan and he wishes to attain very good results so he asked today for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added beauty products and cosmetics so that he can improve his business operations and follow up on the new fashion. In almost all parts of Lebanon, demand for beauty and fashion products continues to be high and that was the reason for Hasan to choose this type of service.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 25-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and lives with his family, which is composed of six working siblings and his parents. He is a great young man who loves his family and really cares to offer them a respectable life. He also cares to take some responsibilities off his father, their main income provider. Mohammad works nonstop, on his own, and has almost eight years of experience in his present occupation. He has been working as a carpenter since 2007. He’s an honest man and above all punctual, which make his customers loyal to him. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase supplies and materials for his business, such as paint, wood and many other items. This Kiva loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him to start his new project properly. He’s doing his best to collect higher revenues and have his own family and children.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and materials such as paint, wood and many other items

loans.name: Serjmyadag

texts.en: Mrs.Serjmayadag is 41 years old and lives with her husband and 2 daughters in an apartment in Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband, Buyant, age 41, works at a local hospital as a security guard. Her daughter, Dolgoon, age 21, studies at university and her other daughter, Ariunzul, age 16, goes to a local secondary school. Serjmayadag has been running a hairstyling business for years and she has gained a lot of customers over the years. She is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to change her apartment windows into vacuum windows, which makes insulation in order to stay warm. She is a hardworking, open-minded, and responsible woman.

loans.use: to change her apartment windows, which makes insulation in order to stay warm

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence is 23 years old. She is married with four children. Her oldest child is twelve and the youngest is seven. Her husband is also a businessman and Gaudence has been in business for seven years. They own a food store and want a loan to buy more sugar, oil, rice, soap, etc. for selling. The profits will buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, oil, rice, and soap for selling

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam is a 43-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married to Ahmad, who has been employed for more than 20 years. They have three children who are still attending school. Working together, Ibtisam and her husband are managing the family’s household expenses and looking to pay their children's study fees.  Ibtisam opened her own artificial flowers shop in 2010. She sells all colors and types of flowers as well. Today, she’s asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added products for her shop such as flowers, ribbons, and many other related items. This will certainly increase the number of customers asking for her services and therefore her revenues. In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop by adding different kinds of flowers to it.

loans.use: to buy flowers, ribbons, and many other related items for her shop

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne, 38 years old, is married and has three children whose ages range from 1 to 4 years old. Her husband is a builder. Yvonne has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy more fabrics to sell. The profits will go towards her savings.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.en: Anne Marie, 23 years old, is married and has two children, 5 and 1 1/2 years old. Her husband is a businessman. Anne Marie has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to increase her business goods such as skirts and shirts. The profits will assist in increasing her capital.

loans.use: To buy more skirts and shirts to sell

loans.name: Tseepil

texts.en: Mr. Tseepil is 31 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife, Altanzul, age 31, works as a saleswoman in the local market. His daughter, Delgermaa, age 7, goes to a local primary school. The borrower has been working various kinds of jobs and he is well-known in town for his kindness and qualified service. He is now starting his own business in wheat flour production and sales on his plot of land. He has the equipment and tools to produce organic wheat flour and is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of wheat to start his organic wheat flour production and sales business. He is a hardworking, optimistic, and reliable person.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of wheat to start his organic wheat flour production and sales business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria has been engaged in a hog raising and rice farming business with her husband for several years, and it is her source of income. Gloria is asking for a loan to buy pig feed, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. In the future, Gloria hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Wafik

texts.en: Wafik is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. They are all attending school. He has been working as a painter for many years in order to supplement his income and be able to better support his family. It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. This is the reason why Wafik is working really hard to be able to take bigger projects. He is requesting today to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to replace his old car with a new one with the intention of increasing his business productivity and therefore his profits. He is very confident that he will be able to achieve considerable growth in the coming season and hopes that the loan will help him increase his income by 15%.

loans.use: to replace his old car with a new one

loans.name: Illuminatha

texts.en: Illuminatha is 23 years old. She is married with one child, who is eight months old. Her husband is a welding man. Illuminatha alters clothing, therefore she wants a loan to buy a better machine to alter clothes. She has been in business for seven years. The profits will go towards her capital.

loans.use: to buy a machine to alter clothing

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of six young children. Isidro needs a loan to buy new fishing nets, fish hooks, lead weights, and fuel for his boat. With this, he will be able to enhance his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell at the market.

Isidro hopes of making his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, fish hooks, lead weights, and fuel for his fishing boat

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en: Mr. Enkhbayar, 31 years old, lives with his parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. During his life, he worked as a construction decorator and saved some cash. Using his cash, he purchased an automobile, which has been used for taxi services since 2011. Now he wants to purchase a microvan to generate more income. According to his own calculations, Mr. Enkhbayar's income will double if he transports people between Ulaanbaatar and Ulan-ude, the capital city of the republic of Buryatia, Russia, using his microvan. So, he is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase a microvan. As a result, he can generate more income for his future family, as well as ensure the wellbeing of his parents. His parents are near retirement age and are looking forward to their son's success.

loans.use: to purchase a microvan for his taxi service

loans.name: Aline

texts.en: Aline is 25 years old. She is married with three children. The oldest is eight and the youngest is three. Her husband is a businessman. She wants to start another business of selling clothes. She plans to use the profits to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Carmen Delia

texts.es:
Carmen Delia de 54 años de edad, casada con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad el cual asiste a la universidad.Ella es Originaria del departamento de León. Lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre ella le gusta cocinar sus comidas preferidas son los tacos, comida típica de la región. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria. Le hubiera gustado ser enfermera titulada.
Gracia a sus su espíritu de emprendedor  y sus ganas de salir adelante, ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa  y cosméticos desde hace 17 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. la rutina de carmen es trabajar una 10 horas diarias.El  objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cosmeticos,pantalones, blusas, short, vestidos, ropa interior, ropa de cama, camisetas, camisolas, y de dicha forma en un futuro no muy lejano sus ingresos aumentara. Carmen Delia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Carmen Delia is 54 years old, and is married with one son, who is currently studying at university. Carmen Delia is from the department of León, which is located in the western region of the country. In her free time, Carmen Delia likes to cook her favorite foods, including tacos and other typical foods from the area. Unfortunately, she never had the financial means necessary to pursue a university level career, though she would have liked to get her nursing degree.

Carmen Delia is an entrepreneurial, hard-working woman who operates her own clothing and cosmetics sales business. She started her business 17 years ago, and she works 10 hours every day. She plans to use the support from this loan to further stock her business with various products, including: cosmetics, pants, blouses, shorts, dresses, shirts, tank tops, underwear, bedding and other items. She hopes that this investment will help her to increase her profits and income and will in turn help her to grow her business. Carmen Delia is grateful for the support and opportunity that Kiva lenders give to people of scarce resources all over the world in developing countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise to stock her business, including: cosmetics, pants, blouses, shorts, dresses, shirts, tank tops, underwear, bedding, etc.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank states, "I started my business in 2004 with my small capital which I obtained from the sale of agricultural products like coffee and bananas. Then I joined UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) in 2005 for financial service assistance so as to expand my business by injecting more capital. With the small assistance I got from UGAFODE, I have been able to build and complete my house. I bought land which expanded my agricultural production. UGAFODE has really enabled me to sustain my timber trade business and I am able to pay school fees for my children and look after my home and wife. I therefore appreciate the good services offered by UGAFODE which have enabled me to improve on my standards of living."

loans.use: To buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita earns a living through her retail business, selling various goods and commodities to the people in her community of Talibon, Bohol. Rosita is asking for a loan to buy additional stock, such as soda, beverages, chips and snack foods, to sell.  She will therefore be able to attract and sell more to the buyers in her store. In the future, Rosita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Tserenbadam

texts.en: Mrs. Tserenbadam, 37 years old, is the female head of her family. She lives with her 2 children in a small house in the Ih-Toiruu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her daughter Olziijargal, age 14, goes to a local school and her son Olziibayar, age 5, goes to a local kindergarten. Tserenbadam moved to Ulaanbaatar after she divorced her husband; she stayed with her relative and worked at the local market for years. Tserenbadam has gained a lot of experience in clothing sales over the years and is now starting her own clothing retail business in the local market. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to import clothes from Erlian, China, to start her own clothing retail business. Tserenbadam is a hardworking and brave woman.

loans.use: to import clothes from Erlian, China, to start her own clothing retail business

loans.name: Badih

texts.en: Badih is a 38-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still studying. He has owned a motorcycle repair shop since 2008. His job consists of repairing motorcycles. He also sells some of them upon request. He became expert in his domain after many years of experience. He has clients visiting him from all over the neighboring villages. Today, he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed mechanic's tools in addition to some spare parts in case they are needed. Badih is looking to expand his business and earn higher revenues. In the future, he is planning to open a bigger store to buy and sell motorcycles.

loans.use: to purchase mechanic's tools

loans.name: Rola

texts.en: Rola is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and five children. Two are working and three are still attending school.  She struggles and works hard with the cooperation of her husband to better enhance her way of living. Her husband has worked on his own for almost 10 years. As for her, she started to work at selling cosmetics. She works from home and visits customers wherever they are located to provide them with her high-quality beauty services. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase beauty products and cosmetics so that she can improve her business operations and follow up on the new fashion. In this way, she will increase her sales and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own cosmetics shop.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: Moise

texts.en: Moise, 27 years old, is single. He has been in business for five years selling window and door materials. Moise wants a loan to buy more door and window materials. The profits will go towards his savings.

loans.use: To buy more doors and windows to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of four young children. The family lives in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Vicenta has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than five years, and it is their source of income. Vicenta is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, hooks and lead weights to improve their fishing business. In the future, Vicenta hopes to make their business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, hooks and lead weights

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, de 37 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa Cecilia y sus 3 hijos: Sarela, Camila y Nataniel, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de su padre hace 10 años. 
Todas las mañanas desde hace 20 años, Pedro despierta para cuidar de sus sembríos de papa, quinua y alverja los cuales cuida con mucho esmero  y paciencia, ya que es un hombre emprendedor. Posee terrenos heredados de sus padres, donde además de sembrar también se dedica a la ganadería con la  crianza de ovejas y cerdos. Desea incursionar en la crianza de vacas, pero todavía no tiene el capital necesario ni los contactos, ya que como él menciona: “”para comenzar un negocio tenemos que tener conocidos”, afirma. Es así que ahora se prepara para el cultivo de papa, pues tiene que aprovechar la temporada agrícola y así mejorar la calidad de sus sembríos, por lo que comprará fertilizantes orgánicos. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Cruz de espinas” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, en todo estos años de trabajo, obtuvo buenos resultados en su negocio y en su vida personal, por lo que se encuentra agradecido, por ello promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, además le agrada pertenecer a su asociación, pues se apoyan y son como una familia.
Pedro, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuirlos entre sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Pedro is a responsible man of 37. He lives with his wife Cecelia and their three children: Sarela, Camila, and Nataniel, whom he cares for in the house that he inherited from his father 10 years ago.

Every morning, as he has for the last 20 years, Pedro wakes up to care for his plantings of potatoes, quinoa, and vetch, which he cares for with great conscientiousness and patience, since he is a forward-looking man. He owns land inherited from his parents, where in addition to planting, he also works in animal husbandry, raising sheep and pigs. He wants to enter into cattle raising, but he still doesn't have the necessary capital nor the contacts, since, as he says, "to begin a business, we have to have acquaintances."  Thus he is now preparing to raise potatoes, since he has to take advantage of the growing season and thus improve the quality of his plantings, for which he will buy organic fertilizers. 

He belongs to the communal bank "Cruz de Espinas" (Cross of Thorns), and this is their fourth loan cycle with MFP. In all these years of work, he has obtained good results in his business and in his personal life, for which he is thankful. For this reason, he promises to be punctual with his payments. In addition, he is pleased to belong to his association, since they support each other and are like a family.

Pedro will invest the money in the purchase of organic compost to spread among his plantings of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz, 46 years old, lives with his wife and 2 children in Lanchkhuti district, West Georgia. Malkhaz works as an artisan and earns a monthly income. The family runs an agricultural business. They have a plot of land, where they grow 30 nut trees and maize. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price. Malkhaz is a very hardworking man and does his best to ensure a good harvest.

Malkhaz has requested a loan to purchase 2 calves and to repair the shed. After purchasing the calves, he will raise them and produce dairy products to sell locally. Malkhaz plans to expand his farm and increase his family's income so as to improve their living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase 2 calves

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 20-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and lives with his parents and three siblings. One of them is working. He, together with his father, is trying his best to bring added income to the family and enhance their way of living. He has been working as a blacksmith for a few years. He learned this profession from experience and doing the best he could to improve and develop himself. Since he wants to enlarge his business and grow his work as well, he decided to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed metal supplies and smithy tools to carry on his work in a proper way.  He wishes to get married and have children. These are the reasons he needs to amplify his income in order to be able to make the needed savings for his wedding and future life plans.

loans.use: to purchase metal supplies and smithy tools

loans.name: Insafa's Group

texts.en:
Insafa, 40 years old, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. She has been running a clothing business for many years. She purchases different types of clothing from the market and sells them in her community. Insafa is interested in purchasing a variety of warm clothes such as gloves, sweaters, coats, mufflers, etc. but finds it difficult due to financial constraints. She has therefore requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan . This will also help her to grow her business. Insafa dreams of providing a successful future for her children. She is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture, Insafa is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of warm clothes to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a farmer from San Jose, Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the farming business for more than ten years now, and it is her source of income. Victoria is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. This will enable her to enhance and improve their harvest and their yield. In the future, Victoria hopes to make their business a success She also dreams of exploring another venture to augment their income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Thess Group

texts.en:
Cristeta is the featured borrower for Thess's group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have been neighbors and friends since they came from the Philippines to work in Lebanon. Cristeta is seated on the right. She works as a housekeeper, like almost all of the Philippine citizens working in Lebanon.

Cristeta is a 55-year-old widow and the mother of two. She works hard to provide her children and grandchildren with a good, healthy living. Her own aim is to fulfill their needs and she hopes that they will be important people in their society.

Criteta is applying for her fourth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to send money to her family in the Philippines to help in raising her grandchildren. She hopes that one day she can go back home and live a normal, happy life among her precious family.

Ramona, in the middle of the photo, is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. This is her fourth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. She is a housekeeper and wants to send the money to help her family in the Philippines.

Leticia is a 62-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She also works as a housekeeper and wants to send money for her children to pay for necessary house and family expenses.

All three of these women wish to be financially capable of going back and spending time with their children.

loans.use: To send money to help her family in the Philippines

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 26-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with Sonia, the mother of their only child. With her cooperation, they are able to cover their expenses, especially the costs for their new baby. Youssef owns a small mini market where he sells all kinds of dairy and daily products in addition to soft drinks and many other products. As for his wife, she works as a teacher and she’s ready to help whenever needed. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for his mini market. In this way, he will be able to diversify his items, increase his revenues and improve his way of living. He looks forward to expanding his grocery store, waiting the perfect time to open other branches and assign his children as owners of these branches.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions for his mini market

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita de 36 años casada con Máximo de 45 años mantiene un matrimonio cuyo fruto del amor son sus 3 hijos John, Ruth y Daisy.
Reside actualmente en una vivienda construida a base de adobe que heredo de sus padres con motivo de su matrimonio.
Se dedica a las actividades agrícolas desde hace 7 años en conjunto con Máximo. 
Luego de trabajar como jornaleros lograron adquirir su propia parcela en donde hasta hoy producen café, achiote y algo de cacao.
Le agrada su trabajo puesto que es una actividad que desempeña junto a su familia trasciende desde sus abuelos a quienes recuerda con mucho cariño.
Los productos que finalmente logra obtener son posteriormente expendidos a los acopiadores de su localidad cuyo precio actual cubre los gastos efectuados en la producción.
A manera de realizar las mejoras en su parcela desea realizar la renovación de sus plantaciones de achiote para el cual debe de contar con el apoyo de jornaleros y plantas listas para ser ingresadas a sus terrenos.
Tiene muchos planes a futuro dentro de las cuales está la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble en beneficio de sus pequeños  a quienes espera brindarles en el futuro un educación de calidad gracias a su trabajo.
Para la actual campaña desea contar con 4,000 nuevos soles los cuales destinará en la contrata de jornaleros y compra de plantas de achiote, con el dinero restante tiene planeado realizar el deshierbo de sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Margarita, who is 36 years old, is married to Máximo, who is 45. They maintain a marriage whose love has produced three children, John, Ruth, and Daisy. Now they live in an adobe house that she inherited from her parents on the occasion of her marriage. Along with Máximo, she has been working in agricultural activities for seven years. After working as day laborers, they managed to acquire their own parcel of land, where up to now they have produced coffee, achiote, and some cacao. She likes her work since it is an activity that she performs together with her family, extending from her grandparents, whom she remembers with great love. The products that she finally manages to obtain are later sold to middlemen in her region, whose current price covers the expenditures of production.

As a way of making improvements in her parcel, she wants to renovate their plantings of achiote, for which she should have the help of day laborers and plants ready to be put into her land.

She has many plans for the future, among which are the construction of their house using quality materials for the benefit of her little ones, to whom she hopes to offer a quality education in the future, thanks to her work. For the present loan, she wants to have 4000 PEN, which will be destined to hire day laborers and buy achiote plants. With the rest of the money, she has planned to do the weeding of her cacao plantings.

loans.use: to hire day laboreres and buy achiote plants

loans.name: Augustine Alieu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 15,100,000 Leones to solve their immediate financial challenges and at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the deductions and repayments on their behalf.

Augustine is the featured leader of this group. A native of Kamabai, in northern Sierra Leone, 32-year-old Augustine is married to a teacher and the couple has 2 children. Augustine has been a school teacher for 10 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy materials for building a house like cement for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a house like cement for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita de 36 años madre y pareja de Teodoro de 30 años comparten una vida conyugal y con quien tiene 3 hijos menores aún.
Es propietaria de una vivienda construida a base de adobe. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy empeñosa y que junto a Teodoro se dedican a la producción de café y achiote.
Llevan 10 años en el rubro y tienen la suerte de contar con unas parcelas muy productivas y fértiles puesto que solo emplean abono orgánico consistente en guano de isla.
Para el normal desarrollo de sus actividades requieren constantemente contratar a jornaleros del lugar principalmente en la temporada de cosechas.
Actualmente tiene planeado realizar el mantenimiento respectivo de sus parcelas las cuales requieren ser desyerbadas para evitar el consumo de nutrientes propios del suelo para el cual es necesario contar con dinero para la campaña venidera y realizar un trabajo fluido.
Tiene muchos planes a futuro dentro de los cuales esta la apertura de un negocio consistente en una tienda de abarrotes y brindarle  a sus pequeños una educación superior de calidad. Para la actual campaña requiere contar con 4,000 nuevos soles para la compra de plantas de café y abono orgánico guano de aves, también debe contar con capital para el pago de los jornaleros quienes desempeñaran las distintas actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Margarita, who is 36 years old, is a mother and the partner of Teodoro, who is 30. They live in free union and have three children who are still minors. She is the owner of an adobe house. She is known for being a very hard-working woman, and along with Teodor, she works in the production of coffee and achiote. They have done this work for 10 years, and they have the good fortune to have some parcels of land that are very productive and fertile, since they only use organic compost, guano (bird manure) from the islands.

In the normal course of their work, they constantly need to hire day laborers from the area, principally at harvest time. Now she has plans to carry out the appropriate maintenance of her parcels, which need to be weeded to avoid the consumption of their nutrients from the soil, for which it is necessary to have money for the coming project to complete the work smoothly.

She has many plans for the future, among which is the opening of a business -- a grocery store -- and offering her little ones a quality higher education. For the present campaign, she needs to have 4000 PEN to buy coffee plants and organic bird manure. She should also have capital to pay the day laborers who will carry out the various productive activities.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and organic compost (bird manure)

loans.name: Karen Lorena

texts.es: karen tiene 28 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Karen antes hacia tortillas para vender, ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Hace un año que estableció su propio negocio en su casa de venta de ropa, vende pantalones, camisas, short, blusas etc. Ha decidido obtener otro préstamo siendo este el octavo ciclo en ODEF, el cual es por 11,000 Lempiras, la inversión que va hacer es para surtir de vestidos y pantalones para vender. Ella quiere seguir trabajando para salir de  sus compromisos, tener solvencia económica y que el negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Karen is 28 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa with her husband and children. Before, Karen  used to make tortillas to sell; she has always been a merchant.

A year ago she established her own business in her home selling clothing. She sells pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, etc. She has decided to obtain another loan, this being her eight loan cycle in ODEF, and it is for 11,000 lempiras.

The investment she is going to make is to stock dresses and pants to sell. She wants to continue working so that she can deal with her commitments, be financially solvent, and see her business grow.

loans.use: To buy ladies' pants and dresses for stocking her store.

loans.name: Gibrilla S.'s Group

texts.en:
The picture above shows teachers of a secondary school situated in Waterloo, a small town near Sierra Leone’s capital city Freetown.  

This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva's in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone to request a loan of 7,000,000 Leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, these teachers will be able to buy or invest in things that they can not afford with their mere salaries alone. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar will deduct their repayments from their salaries and repay SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf. 

Gibrilla is the featured leader of this group. The 46-year-old is a native of one of the villages in Yoni, in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a housewife and the couple has 6 children. He has been a professional teacher for 21 years now. 

Gibrilla has requested this loan in order to purchase materials for the completion of a family dwelling house he has begun constructing.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the completion of a family dwelling house.

loans.name: Antorcha Encendida De Taulabe Group

texts.es: Doña Mirian tiene 55 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, y vive en el municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua. ella siempre se ha dedicado a realizar actividades de negocio, anteriormente elaboraba tortillas para vender y hace 6 años estableció su pequeña pulpería para vender productos de primera necesidad, vende arroz, frijoles, huevos, manteca, azúcar, pan, refrescos, churros, pastas, productos de limpieza etc. doña Mirian ha obtenido varios prestamos para invertir en el negocio, actualmente solicita el doceavo préstamo en forma grupal para surtir el negocio de productos como arroz, pan, frijoles, manteca, refrescos y churros, con el fin de obtener ingresos económicos y ofrecer más productos a sus clientes. Su deseo es mantener siempre activo el negocio para que le genere ingresos y vivir mejor con su familia. El grupo se llama Antorcha encendida de Taulabe, esta formado por dos integrantes: doña Mirian de blusa negra a la derecha y a la izquierda esta Santos Yolanda, las dos tienen pulpería y viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es de 20,000 Lempiras y lo invertirán en surtir el negocio.
texts.en:
Mirian is 55 years old, married and has two children. She lives in the town of Taulabé, Comayagua. She has always engaged in business activities. Previously she made tortillas to sell, and six years ago started her small general store to sell basic household necessities.

She sells rice, beans, eggs, lard, sugar, bread, soft drinks, snacks, pastas, cleaning products, etc.  Mirian has obtained several loans to invest in the business. Currently she is applying for her 12th group loan, so that she can stock her business with products such as rice, bread, beans, lard, soft drinks, and snacks. Her aim is to earn income and offer more products to her customers. 

Her wish is to always keep her business going, so that it will generate income and allow her and her family to live a better life.

The group is called "Antorcha Encendida de Taulabé´" (The Lighted Torch of Taulabé) and consists of two members: Marian in a black blouse on the right, and on the left is Santos Yolanda. Both have small general stores and live in the same community. The group loan is for 20,000 lempiras, and they will invest it in stocking their businesses.

loans.use: To buy rice, bread, beans, lard, snacks, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
Gudelia, de 37 años, es una madre responsable. Vive desde hace 3 años en casa de su hermana, junto a sus 4 hijos pequeños. Ella posee pocos terrenos agrícolas, los que tiene fueron heredados de parte de su madre, ahí siembra habas, papa, cebada en pocas cantidades, a veces los alimentos los utiliza para consumo propio y cuando el precio está muy alto los comercializa a la ciudad de Jauja, pero según cuenta, en días donde no tiene que cuidar de sus cultivos, los dedica a trabajar en otros terrenos agrícolas como peón. Más su principal actividad económica se centra en el cuidado de animales como cerdos, ovejas y toros, los cuales compra para luego venderlos a un mayor precio entre los carniceros que siempre llegan a su casa, ya que conocen del oficio de Gudelia, ahora por falta de capital no tiene muchos animales que engordar, espera poder trabajar con su asociación y poco a poco adquirir la cantidad que requiere para obtener más ganancias. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario  “las abejitas” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le otorgaron, pues comenzará a mejorar su negocio con el préstamo que obtuvo. 
Gudelia, invertirá el dinero en la compra de un par de cerdos más para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Gudelia, 37, is a responsible mother. For 3 years she has been living in her sister's home together with her 4 small children. She has little agricultural land which was inherited from her mother. There she plants small quantities of beans, potatoes, and barley. At times, the food is used for personal consumption and when the price is very high, she sells them in the city of Jauja. But according to what she says, on days when she doesn't have to look after her plants, she works in other agricultural fields as a laborer. However her main economic activity focuses on the care of animals such as pigs, sheep, and bulls which she buys in order to then sell at a higher price to the butchers who frequently come her home because they know of her trade. Presently, due to a lack of funds, many animals are not gaining weight. She hopes to be able to work with her communal bank, and little by little, acquire the funds she needs in order to yield more profit. She belongs to the solidarity group "las abejitas" and this is her second loan with MFP. She is grateful for the opportunity that they gave her to progress since she will improve her business with the loan that she obtained. 
Gudelia will use this loan to buy two more pigs to increase her livestock.

loans.use: to buy two more pigs.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Ii Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento NUEVA ESPERANZA II está  compuesto por diez integrantes seis mujeres y cuatro varones,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Sonia tiene 44 años, tiene 2 hijos que tiene la edad de 11 y 14 años,  se dedica a la venta de comida  una zona de Nueva Esperanza,   Este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Sonia va a usar este préstamo para Invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, como arroz, fideo, papa y aceite por mayor Su razón para solicitar este préstamo por la falta de capital, la Sra. Sonia va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos, para la elaboración de sus comidas, la Sra. Sonia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo  brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" communal bank is made up of 10 members: six women and four men. The chair of the group is Sonia. She is 44 years old and has two children, ages 11 and 14. 

She sells food in an area of Nueva Esperanza. This loan is her second with the institution. Sonia is going to use this loan to buy ingredients at wholesale for making her meals, such as rice, noodles, potatoes and cooking oil. 

Her reason for requesting this loan is her lack of working capital. Sonia is going to use the profits to continue buying ingredients for making her meals. 

Sonia is a very hard-working person. She feels happy, and grateful to the institution for the support provided, as this is her only means of supporting herself.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, noodles and potatoes.

loans.name: Alibala

texts.en:
Alibala is a 60-year-old man who is married with two adult children.  He is the owner of a barbershop and has 30 years of experience in this field.  Given his long years of experience in this business he already has a lot of customers.  He says that the secret of his success is his friendliness and professionalism. 
 
His monthly income is 170 AZN and his total income, including his pension, is about 300 AZN.  However, this is not enough to cover his family needs and to help his grandchildren.  Hence, he would like to increase his income.  For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN.  He will buy new tools and improve his work conditions to attract new clients.  This will be his third loan and he had good loan history.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his barbershop.

loans.name: Ashiq

texts.en:
Mr. Ashiq is a 25-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since 2005, Ashiq has been running his own general store near his house, which is a very successful business for his family.  He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan.

He is currently in need of purchasing some products for his store including powdered milk, flour, rice, chips, oil, soap, candies, etc.  But, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult.  Therefore, he has requested a loan for 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.  This will not only help him to grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings.  He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase products for his general store.

loans.name: Los Hijos Del Sol Group

texts.es:
Este es el  grupo Los Hijos del Sol
Grupo recién formado lo integran 5 socios, uno de ellos es Adrian; que ha sido elegido el presidente del grupo. Adrian tiene 33 años es soltero y vive solo. El se dedica a la albañilería, semanalmente trabaja aproximadamente 48 horas , su trabajo es muy sacrificado pero le permite solventar sus gastos y apoyar a sus padres, son 08 años que se dedica a este oficio y le va muy bien,su trabajo es muy solicitado y son muchas personas que lo buscan para diferentes contratos, lo que más le gusta es realizar trabajos en cerámica y porcelanatos, el dinero de su préstamo le servira para renovar algunas herramientas desgastadas por el uso, esto le permitirá realizar mejores trabajos,en el futuro desea iniciar algún negocio que le permita trabajar en su misma casa.
Adrian está agradecido por su préstamo  le gustaría decir ¡Muchas gracias por apoyar a mi grupo comunal!
texts.en:
This is the recently formed "Los Hijos del Sol" group, made up of five members. One of them is Adrian, who has been elected chair of the group. 

Adrian is 33, single, and lives alone. He is a construction worker, and works approximately 48 hours a week. His work is very demanding, but it allows him to meet his expenses and support his parents. He has been engaged in this occupation for eight years and it is going very well. His work much requested, and many people seek him out for various contracts. What he likes best is doing work in pottery and porcelain. 

The money from the loan will help him replace some worn-out tools. This will allow him to do better work. In the future he wishes to start some business that will allow him to work in his own home. Adrian is grateful for the loan, and would like to say, "Thank you very much for supporting my communal bank!"

loans.use: To replace work tools.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana, de 61 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Bonifacio y una de sus 9 hijos: Lisenia, a la que cuida en la casa que alquiló hace 12 años.  A pesar de su avanzada edad ella se dedica a varias actividades, “gusto de estar activa”, comenta. Su día se centra en la siembra de diversos productos como: papa, habas, alverja y demás hortalizas, sus cultivos son en gran cantidad y en terrenos propios, además de poseer vacas lecheras las que le producen leche diaria la cual vende a buen precio. Espera entonces poder tener mucho éxito en esta campaña agrícola pues desea pagar los estudios de su menor hija que estudia administración en una de las mejores universidades del valle. “Saqué profesionales a mis hijos, con esfuerzo y trabajo, por lo que también bordo fustanes, vendo comida y poseo una tienda de comestibles”, comenta. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “señoras del milenio” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, en todo estos años de trabajo, obtuvo buenos resultados en su negocio y en su vida personal, por lo que se encuentra agradecido, por ello promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, además le agrada pertenecer a su asociación, pues se apoyan y son como una familia.
Adriana, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcirlo entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Adriana, 61, is a simple woman. She lives in the company of her husband, Bonifacio, and one of her 9 children: Lisenia, whom she takes care of in the home that she rented 12 years ago. In spite of her advanced age, she does various activities: "I enjoy being active" she says. Her day revolves around the planting of various products such as potatos, beans, peas, and other vegetables. She grows a great amount of crops on her own land. In addition, she owns dairy cows which produce milk daily which she sells at a good price. She hopes then to be very successful in this year's growing season since she wants to pay for the studies of her youngest daughter who studies administration in one of the best universities in the valley. "I brought out the professionals in my children, with effort and hard work, I also embroider traditional garments, sell food and operate a grocery store" she says. She belongs to the solidarity group "señoras del milenio” and this is her sixth loan with MFP. In all her years of work, she has gotten good results in her business and in her personal life for which she is grateful. Because of this, she promises to be timely in her payments. Moreover, she likes being a part of this communal bank since they all support one another and are like a family. 
Adriana will use this loan to buy organic fertilizer to spread among her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en:
Kamran is a 31-year-old man who runs a private business as a market vendor.  His primary activity is selling food products.  Kamran sells different kind of goods such as yogurt, sausages, candies, cookies and macaroni, and has been doing so for the last 8 years.  He is responsible for his wife and three children. 

His business brings a stable income of 180 AZN and his spouse helps to sell products from the shop.  He would like to increase his income.  For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1500 AZN which he will use to diversify and purchase more products for his shop.  This will be his second loan and he has good loan history.

loans.use: to buy more food products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Doña María Eugenia casada, madre de tres hijos por quienes vela día y noche para darles lo necesesario en la vida, es una clienta esforzada y trabajadora siempre en su cafetín ubicado en el mercado de Managua, continua con sus ventas de prendas de plata desde hace muchos años, en esta ocasión está solicitando su sexto crédito para mejorar su casa específicamente para la puesta de un portón y parte del muro frontal del mismo, para ser posible esto necesita comprar cemento, arena, bloques, hierro y comprar el portón ya hecho asi con el tiempo cada vez va avanzando Maria Eugenia mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria is a married mother of 3 children whom she watches over day and night in order to give them what's necessary in life. She is a hardworking and steadfast client who is always in her snack stand located in the Managua market. She has continued selling silver jewelry for many years. On this occasion, she is applying for her sixth loan in order to improve her home, specifically for placement of a gate and part of its front wall. In order for this to be possible, she needs to buy cement, sand, blocks, iron, and the pre-made gate. In this way, Maria is gradually improving her home over time.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, iron, and a gate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman from Bohol, Philippines. 

Julia has been engaged in the farming business for several years now. Julia helps her husband in tilling in their farm. Julia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and eventually their harvest.

Julia hopes to make their farming venture a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Jose Victor

texts.es: José Víctor de  treinta y cinco  años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; el posee una panadería y vende pan en variedad francés y dulce,  quesadillas, salpores, pastelitos, tortas entre otros, es muy conocido en la zona pues elabora el pan más exquisito del lugar, el rico aroma del pan cuando es porque está recién hecho y eso atrae mucha clientela se siente muy satisfecho al ver que las personas se van contentas del lugar, todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente, José es un hombre visionario con muchas ganas de ganarse un futuro más próspero, piensa que si tiene un comienzo tendrá la lucha y si tiene la lucha lograra la victoria, ahora está buscando la lucha y quiere acrecentar el negocio pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor,  manteca, jaleas, azúcar, sal, bandejas, etc.  José Víctor es muy responsable y con un buen record crediticio tiene confianza que podrá saldar la deuda pero sobre todo tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Víctor is thirty five years old and lives with his life partner and children in their own home. He owns a bakery where he sells French and sweet bread, as well as quesadillas, salpores (a traditional type of biscuit), cakes and pies, etc. He is well known in the area as he makes the most exquisite bread around. The rich aroma of his freshly made bread attracts many customers. It is very satisfying for him to see his customers leave happy. In addition to providing excellent service, everything he sells is of high quality and at accessible prices. 

José Víctor is a visionary man who wants a more prosperous future. He believes that if he has a start, he will be challenged, and if he is challenged, he will be victorious. The challenge he is looking for now is to expand his business, but he needs capital. For this reason he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. This will enable him to purchase flour wholesale, as well as lard, jams, sugar, salt and trays, etc. José Víctor is very responsible and has a good credit record. Therefore he is confident that he will be able to pay off his debt, but above all he has faith that he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale, as well as lard, jams, sugar, salt and trays

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en:
Sabira is a 60-year-old woman who is married with two sons.  She breeds sheep and cattle for meat purposes with local butchers.  Sabira has 20 years of experience in this field and she thanks her husband, who taught her how to look after cattle and who helps her to run the business.  Her husband is currently on a pension. 

Sabira usually buys small cattle and sheep, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Meat selling brings an income of 80 AZN per month.  Beef and mutton are very popular products in Azerbaijan.  People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma, and they always use yogurt sauce.  She also sells sheep wool which is useful for clothing and blankets. 

Sabira applied for a loan of 2000 AZN to purchase three cattle and eight sheep.   This will be her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy three cattle and eight sheep.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is 37 years old and married with four (4) children, all of whom are school going. Asaph is a peasant farmer majoring in growing bananas (plantain) and maize but he also has a nursery and primary school as another source of income. He started the school to bring the services nearer to residents of the village on the outskirts of Kagadi town.

Asaph wants a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to complete construction at his school and have the pupils study in a good environment. He is always challenged by limited capital and parents not paying school fees on time and in full installments.

His dream is to see the school grow to a better standard and to improve his agricultural business for a better source of income for the family. Asaph is confident the relationship with UGAFODE and the Kiva lenders will grow strong since he is confident of meeting his loan obligations on time.

loans.use: To complete construction of the school

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is a married woman and a mother of four children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines.  She earns a living by selling snack foods.  Her husband is a fisherman.

Ma. Teresa is in need of additional capital for the expansion of her business.  She is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell, such as candy, bread, chips, and other snack foods.  With this, she will cater to and be able to attract more buyers into her store, thus increasing sales and income.

In the future, Ma. Teresa hopes to make her business a success and to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional snack food items to sell.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 36 years old. She is married with six children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest is one and a half. Her husband is a businessman. She has been in business for eight years. She needs a loan to buy more children's clothing to sell. The profit will assist her in building a house.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Asifa

texts.en: Ms Asifa is a 28-year-old, divorced woman. She has had a clothing sewing business for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her father receives a pension which is not enough to bear family expenditures. That is why Asifa is working hard to contribute to the family income. She has become popular in her town for her fine stitching. She needs to purchase more raw material including spools of threads, fabric, packs of buttons and needles to cater to her customers without delay. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 30000. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials including spools of threads, fabric, packs of buttons and needles to cater to her customers.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Ms Robina is a 34 year old married woman. She has been successfully running a beauty parlor for the last 15 years. Initially she faced many problems but with the passage of time she has attained a number of regular customers. She makes enough to lead a decent life. She is the mother of 4 children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs.20, 000 to purchase more packs of beauty products, cleansers, and makeup kits with packs of hair rollers.  She then would be able to meet the increasing demand. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase packs of beauty products, cleansers, and makeup kits with packs of hair rollers.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Ms Shahnaz is 40 years old and a mother of five. She has been doing a tailoring business for many years. She joined her husband's business right after her marriage. From then on, they both worked together to meet the needs of their children by stitching clothes for the people of their community.

In order to complete orders on time, Shahnaz contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 20,000. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase spools of thread and packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers time after time. She wishes to provide a good standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread and packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Ms Shabana is a 39 year old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been in the business of milk sales since many years. Her husband is a salaried person who works in a factory but his earnings are not enough for his family. She started the business of milk selling with the support of her husband. She has only one cow and two calves. In order to cater to more customers in her community she needs to purchase another cow. For this she contacted Kashf foundation and applied a loan of Rs.15000. She is in her 4th loan cycle and is very much satisfied with the support.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Eglecerio

texts.en: Eglecerio is a fisherman from Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the fishing business for 20 years and works hard to meet the needs of his family, including the schooling of his children. Eglecerio is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, fish hooks, lead weights, and fuel for his boat. With these items, Eglecerio will be able to enhance his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, fish hooks, lead weights, and fuel for his boat

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 30 years old.  She is married with a one-year-old child and her husband is a businessman.  She has a food store that has been in business for one year.  She wants a loan to buy more sugar, rice, and alcohol.  The profit will go towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy more food for her store.

loans.name: Roula

texts.en:
Roula is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been working in the child care business since she opened her nursery in 2000. Roula helps her husband make their living and reply to their children needs. Roula is a hard worker with a very good reputation in her region. All of her customers trust her a lot with their children's safety. 

Today Roula is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy an LCD TV and change the nursery's decoration to keep it attractive to her customers and specifically their children. This step will improve her business and increase her income.

Roula hopes to keep on expanding her business as much as she can and to be capable of employing more people to help in taking care of the increased number of children she's heading towards.

loans.use: To buy an LCD TV and to change the nursery's decoration

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррине 39 лет. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Заррина грамотная женщина. Она работает учительницей в средней школе. Она преподает историю. Все ее коллеги уважают ее, так как она добрая и порядочная женщина. Заррина учится в Худжандском Государственном Университете для получения второго образования. Она является студентом 3 курса заочного отделения. Она одна из лучших студентов и успешно размещает работу с учебой. Заррина запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
