Adelaida, one of the members, sells many kinds of clothing. She is hardworking and says that, with the group's help, she has been able to grow and improve her business. She wants to keep expanding and investing in her business. So, she is applying for a loan to buy summer clothing to fill her customer orders.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power's solar lighting products.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El Señor Marcos tiene 39 años es Taxista vive en la Ciudad de Coronel Oviedo. Esta casado con la Sra. Nélida desde  hace mas de 17 años.
Comenta además que son una familia muy trabajadora todos se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante. El Señor Marcos comenta que se gano con mucho esfuerzo todo lo que hasta ahora esta teniendo ya que dejo a su familia  y se fue a España por tres años y estando allá mando la plata para comprar para su taxi, y ahora solicita de este crédito para la compra de una moto, que le ayudará también en su negocio.
Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Marcos is a 39-year-old taxi driver. He lives in the city of Coronel Oviedo. He has been married to his wife Nélida for over 17 years. He says that besides the fact that his family is hardworking, they all help each other to get ahead. Marcos says that he painstakingly earned everything that he has up to this point, considering that he left his family and went to Spain for 3 years, and while there, sent money home in order to buy his taxi. Presently, he is applying for this loan to buy a motorbike that will also help his business. He is grateful for the assistance that he is receiving since it will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
El Sr. Silverio vive en su casa de la ciudad de Luque, es casado. Tiene un comedor y una pequeña despensa desde el año 1992, en su comedor y despensa le ayudan su señora e hijos respectivamente. El préstamo que solicita es para invertir en compra de fideos, arroz, yerba, azúcar y otros alimentos para su despensa y su comedor.
El es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que con el tiempo y con su esfuerzo quiere salir adelante y ser un gran microemprendedor. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Silverio lives in his house in the city of Luque and is married. He has had a restaurant and small store since 1992. His wife and children help him in his restaurant and store. The loan that he is requesting is to invest in the purchase of noodles, rice, herbs, sugar, and other foods for his store and restaurant. 

He is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person, who with time and effort wants to move forward and be a great micro-entrepreneur. He is grateful for the help that he is receiving, and the loan will be of much help.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, herbs, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité de nombre, 8 DE DICIEMBRE son 13 señoras que poseen diversas actividades. También está la Sra. Inocencia que cuenta con un tambo, en donde suministra leche, elabora queso, panes, etc. Ella es una persona con muchos deseos de salir adelante y es por ello que se esfuerza al máximo para salir adelante y poder ayudar a su familia por medio de ese esfuerzo. Ella solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de herramientas, muebles para mejorar el negocio, y demás, para poder seguir trabajando y ofreciendo un buen producto a sus clientes.
En la foto hay mas miembros, ya que el grupo tiene personas que las ayudan, pero que no estan retirando en este momento ningún crédito.
texts.en:
The committee, 8 de Diciembre (December 8), is comprised of 13 women who do diverse activities. Inocencia has a small dairy farm, where she provides milk, makes cheese, bread, etc. She is a person with the desire to move forward and because of that she is making the effort to the maximum to move forward and be able to help her family through that effort. She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of tools, furniture to improve the business, and move, in order to be able to continue working and offering a good product to her customers. 

In the photo there are more members, given that the group has people who help them, but who are not applying for a loan at this time.

loans.use: to buy tools, furniture to improve the business, and more.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 7º ciclo con 16 integrantes. Son señoras que se esfuerzan y tienen sus labores del día a día para salir adelante y solventar los gastos diarios del hogar. La intención de ellas fue formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras con el fin de lograr mejorar sus emprendimientos y calidad de vida.
La Sra. Lurdes es una de las integrantes que se esmera muchísimo para poder ayudar a su familia, ella se dedica exclusivamente en la venta de bebidas en su casa, ya cuenta con  sus clientes formados, ella está muy contenta por formar parte del  programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras  dice que  su actividad es muy provechosa ya que nota el progreso de su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir teniendo buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Currently the committee is in its 7th cycle with 16 members. They are women who make the effort and do work day by day in order to move forward and pay for the daily expenses of the home. Their intention was to form part of the committee of Women Entrepreneurs with the goal of achieving the improvement of their undertakings and quality of life. 

Lurdes is one of the members who is trying very hard to be able to help her family. She exclusively works in the sale of beverages from her house. She already has formed a customer base. She is very happy to be part of the Committee of Women Entreprenuers. She says that this activity is very useful, and notes the progress of her family. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of beverages, so that she can continue having a good variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages in order to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Dinamicas Group

texts.es:
El comité  Mujeres Dinamicas, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Monica que se mostró muy interesada por el programa.
Este comité se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, están aprendiendo la importancia de trabajar en equipo dentro de un grupo con responsabilidad, honestidad y comunicación, demuestran conciencia por el compromiso asumido con el comité como también con la Fundación.
Todas las miembros se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, chanchos, cabras y demás, y con gran esfuerzo y sumado a la ayuda de la fundación están saliendo adelante.
Monica, solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados que podrá dar a sus animales, y de esa forma poder darles un buen cuidado para después venderlos
texts.en:
The committee Dynamic Women was formed by Monica's initiative, who was very interested in the program. This committee is in the second cycle. They are learning the importance of working as a team within a group with responsibility, honesty, and communication. They show awareness for the commitment that they have taken on with the committee and also with the Foundation. All of the members are dedicated to the raising and selling of farm animals, like chickens, pigs, goats, and more, and with a great effort and the added help of the foundation, they are moving forward. 

Monica is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of animal feed that she will be able to give to her animals, and in this way be able to give them good care to be able to sell them afterward.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Mabel Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Mabel  sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de variedad de zapatos cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de zapatos por mayor, ahora en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de variedad de mercadería como zapatos deportivos.  para surtir su negocio, ya que desea brindar variedad de productos a su clientela.
texts.en:
Sra. Mabel continues her business of selling a variety of shoes. She did very well with the loan she obtained for buying shoes in bulk.

On this occasion, she is now requesting a loan so that she can buy a variety of merchandise, such as sports shoes, to restock her business. She wants to offer a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy sports shoes in bulk.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El comité San Ramon esta en el cuarto ciclo vienen trabajando muy bien en forma conjunta en la comunidad organizando actividades para fortalecer el comité. También se ayudan en la colocación de sus productos. Se destacan en la zona por el espíritu emprendedor.
Todas las miembros se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, y por medio de este sacrificado trabajo salen adelante. Simona solicita de este crédito para la compra de balanceados para poder seguir trabajando y dando a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Roman" is in their fourth loan cycle. They have been working very well together organizing activities in the community in order to strengthen the communal bank. They also help one another with product placement. They stand out in the area for their entrepreneurial spirit. 
All of the members breed and sell farm animals, and through this demanding work, they are able to get ahead. Simona is requesting this loan in order to buy animal feed to be able to keep working and give her family what it needs.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Virgen de Lourdes, se encuentra en el primer ciclo, están aprendiendo a trabajar en equipo con responsabilidad, honestidad y se ayudan siempre las unas a las otras para salir adelante.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Mari, quien es la presidenta, ella tiene un copetín donde vende todo tipo de productos, como ser comestibles, bebidas, golosinas y demás. Ella comenta que a parte de su trabajo siempre trata de ayudar a sus amigas y las anima a seguís siempre luchando por sus sueños.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder comprar golosinas, bebidas y demás, y asi seguir ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Committee Virgen de Lourdes is in its first cycle. They are learning to work as a team with responsibility, honesty, and they always help each other to move forward.                                

One of these women is Mari, who is the president. She has a small store in which she sells all types of products, like foodstuffs, drinks, candy, and more. She comments that apart from her job she always tries to help her friends and encourages them to always continue fighting for their dreams. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy candy, drinks, and more, and in this way continue offering a good variety for her customers.

loans.use: to buy candy, drinks, and more.

loans.name: Margine Del Socorro

texts.es: Margine trabaja incansablemente a diario para mantener a sus hijos y darles lo mejor dentro de sus posibilidades, ella se levanta todos los días muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos en la venta, negocio que tiene varios años de trabajar en él para el sustento de la familia al lado de su esposo quien también la apoya con sus ingresos, este 4to crédito lo solicita para invertir comprando variedades de ropa, calzado y cosméticos de damas y caballeros para mantener siempre con productos su negocio que le ha generado buenas ganancias con el cual ha podido pagar sus créditos por lo que está muy contenta y agradecida de poder contar con ello.
texts.en:
Margine works tirelessly each day to support her children and provide them the best within her means. She wakes up very early every day so that she can offer products to sell. Margine has worked at her business for many years in order to support her family. Her husband also provides support with his income.

This will be the fourth loan she has requested and she will invest the proceeds by purchasing a variety of clothing, shoes, and cosmetics for women and men. Margine always wants to maintain a supply of products for her business so that she can generate good earnings which she has used to repay her loans. She is very pleased and grateful to have access to the loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres de Villa Ygatimi se unieron y surge el grupo llamado San Sebastian, que gracias al trabajo de sus miembros ya están en su segundo ciclo.
Todas ellas son mujeres de campo, humildes, que desde sus casas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, con lo que quieren ayudar a sus familias. Una de ellas es Mariza, quien pide de este crédito para la compra de afrecho, maíz, y demás balanceados para sus animales.
Agradecen por esta gran oportunidad que les da la fundación y kiva, ya que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Twelve women from Villa Ygatimi have joined together and formed a group called “San Sebastian”. Thanks to their work, the members have now reached their second loan cycle.

All of the members are humble farming women. From their homes, they raise and sell farm animals in order to help their families. One of these women is Mariza. She is requesting a loan in order to buy bran, corn, and other types of balanced feed for her animals.

The members appreciate this great opportunity given to them by Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that they can move forward.

loans.use: to buy bran, corn, and other types of animal feed.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, de 43 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de una de su 4 hijas: Katherin a la que cuida en la casa que heredó desde hace 10 años.  El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de algunos ingredientes y platos descartables.  
Desde hace mas de 5 años se dicha a la venta de comida en la puerta de su casa ya que dispone de sus vitales  herramientas de trabajo  que es su carrito sandwichera  y sus bancas para atender a sus clientes, trabaja todos los días en su negocio especialmente en las tardes hasta la noche, generalmente llega a vender todo lo que ha preparado y puede ver la rentabilidad de su negocio, en ocasiones tiene la ayuda de una de sus hermanas  pero en la mayoría de oportunidades realiza su negocio ella sola y disfruta de realizar este trabajo porque le permite estar al pendiente de sus hijos y es independiente en las decisiones de su negocio. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido con el apoyo obtenido, pues de esa manera se siente tranquila de invertir, además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que en su asociación le enseñaron a ser responsable.
Celia, invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumos para la preparación de su comida y si el dinero el lacaza un nuevo carrito.
texts.en:
Celia, age 43, is a simple woman. She lives with one of her four daughters, Katherin, who she cares for in the house that she inherited 10 years ago. Celia will invest this loan in the purchase of a few ingredients and disposable plates.

She says that she began selling food from the doorstep of her house more than five years ago. The vital pieces of work equipment at her disposal are a small sandwich cart and some benches so that she can serve her customers. Celia works every day at her business, especially in the afternoons until evening. She generally sells everything she prepares, thus she is able to see a profit from her business. On occasion she has help from one of her sisters, but most of the time she manages her business by herself. She enjoys this type of work because it enables her to look after her children and be independent with the decisions related to her business.

This is her 10th loan with MFP. Celia is grateful for the support she has received because she is able to invest with her mind at ease. In addition, she promises to be punctual with her payments. Her Communal Bank has taught her how to be responsible. Celia will invest the money in supplies for preparing her dishes. If there is any money left over, it will be designated for a new cart.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, gravel, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Ailua

texts.en: Ailua is a married woman with 6 children. She is requesting this loan to buy new materials to repair her taxi. She wants to make it look neat and clean and to replace some of the old parts that are worn out. Ailua joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tyres, fluid oil, engine oil, seat covers etc. for her taxi

loans.name: Keiana

texts.en: Keiana is a 42-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She plans to start a small business, providing bingo games in her community.  Keiana needs a loan to buy bingo supplies. She will use her profits to improve her business and support her family. Kaiana joined SPBD in 2012 in order to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bingo paper and a new bingo machine

loans.name: Seneuefa

texts.en:
Seneuefa is 49 years old and married with eight children. She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community and has been doing this for two years. Seneuefa has requested a loan to to buy flour, salt, meat, and oil. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Seneuefa will make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, meat, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Katelinapoa

texts.en: Katelinapoa is a 48-year-old married woman who has 7 children. She makes and sells ice cakes (flavoured ice) in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Katelinapoa needs a loan to buy ice cake ingredients. She plans to use her profits to provide financial support for her family. Katelinapoa has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy flavour mixture, sugar, and foam cups to make ice cakes

loans.name: Fuamata

texts.en: Fuamata is a 47-year-old married woman with 6 children. She would like to start growing taro and bananas to earn a living. Fuamata has requested a loan to buy a plant sprayer, chemicals, bush knives and vegetable seeds. She has been a member of SPBD for a year. Fuamata will spend her profits in improving her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a wheel barrow, a plant sprayer etc.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Doña María tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 7 hijos y vive junto a dos de sus hijos menores de edad en santa cruz de Yojoa.  Ella comenzó generando sus propios ingresos vendiendo tamales, y hace tres años compro ropa, calzado, carteras y otro tipo de mercadería para vender. Esta venta la tiene en su casa, allí la visitan sus clientes. para el negocio a obtenido varios prestamos, lleva 6 ciclos con el actual, el cual es por 20,000 Lempiras, con esta inversión va surtir de blusas, sandalias, carteras para ofrecer mas producto al cliente e incrementar las ventas y mejorar sus nivel económico. Su plan de trabajar es para vivir mejor con su familia, darles el estudio a sus hijos y mejorar el negocio.
texts.en:
Doña María is 53 years old and a single mother. She has seven children and lives with the two youngest ones in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Doña María started earning her own income by selling tamales. Three years ago, she began buying clothing, shoes, purses, and other types of merchandise to sell. Her sales are conducted at her house since her customers visit with her there. María has obtained several loans for her business and is currently in her sixth loan cycle.

This loan is in the amount of 20,000 HNL and will be invested in an inventory of blouses, sandals, and purses. This will enable her to offer more products to her customers, increase her sales, and improve her financial standing. Her plans include living better with her family, providing for her children’s education, and improving her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, sandals, jeans, purses, and other items.

loans.name: José Silverio

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos, con su actual pareja tiene una niña de dos años de edad. Desde la edad de los 13 años se ha dedicado a la crianza de ganado, su abuela fue quien le enseño ese trabajo. Para comprar los animales, él viaja al tiangue más cercano que esta a unos veinte kilómetros de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cuatro bueyes pequeños para criarlos. Con la compra de los animales, pretende aprovechar los residuos de la cosecha de maíz para alimentar a los bueyes para venderlos posteriormente y obtener ganancias. De esas ganancias desea comprar otros bueyes, ya que a él le gusta mucho trabajar con bovinos.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old, married, and has three children. He and his current wife have a two-year-old daughter. Since the age of 13, José has been raising livestock. His grandmother was the person responsible for teaching him this line of work. In order to buy animals, he must travel to El Tiangue, which is approximately 20 kilometers from his house.

José is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo so that he can buy four small oxen to raise. After he purchases the animals, he intends to take advantage of the residuals from his corn crop to feed the oxen. He will sell the animals later so that he can earn a profit. With these earnings, he wants to buy more oxen. José greatly enjoys working with animals.

loans.use: to buy four small oxen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, shoes, and a mannequin.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 38 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos y vive junto a ellos y su esposo en el municipio de santa cruz de Yojoa. Ella lleva 8 años de dedicarse a la venta de comidas. Hace tacos, baleadas, pollo frito con tajadas y carne asada para vender. En su aldea ya tiene establecida su clientela. ha mantenido estable su negocio mediante la inversión de varios prestamos que ha obtenido en ODEF, actualmente esta solicitando el tercer préstamo que es por 15,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de insumos como carnes, condimentos, harina, manteca y otros que utiliza para hacer comidas y vender. Su objetivo es tener un mejor nivel de vida y mantener activo el negocio. Como meta personal es adquirir artículos para su hogar, crecer como persona, mantener su buen record crediticio y ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Martiza is 38 years old and has four children. She lives with her husband and children in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Maritza has been selling food for eight years. She prepares tacos, “baleadas” (the Honduran version of a burrito), fried chicken with plantains, and roasted meat to sell. Maritza has an established clientele in her neighborhood. She has been able to maintain a stable business by investing the various loans she obtained from ODEF.

Maritza is currently requesting her third loan, which amounts to 15,000 HNL, so that she can invest in the purchase of supplies such as meat, condiments, flour, lard, and other products that she uses in preparing the food that she sells. Her goals are to have a better standard of living and to maintain an active business. On a personal level, she hopes to acquire furnishings for her home, grow as an individual, maintain a good credit record, and help her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, flour, lard, and other products used in preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Hilmy Group

texts.en: This group is called Hilmy Group, which consists of 4 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER. Ibtsam is a 29-years-old married woman and has one child. She is a working woman who is trying to live a comfortable life with her family. She is a housewife who would like to buy home appliances. She applied for a youth loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy a refrigerator to use in her home. She hopes to have furniture.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to use in her home.

loans.name: Fahmy Group

texts.en:
This group is called Fahmy Group, which consists of 4 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. 
Rogia is 24 years old, married, and has two children who lives in Taiz. She is illiterate. She owns a small house and intends to rebuild her house. She has applied for a youth loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en: Taghreed is a 52 year old housewife with a married daughter and a son. Her husband receives a military pension that they count on for a living. Taghreed contributes a little to the family finances with her home business in sewing and tailoring. Now she wants to improve her business and she is applying for a loan so that she can buy more thread and fabric.

loans.use: to buy more thread and fabric

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 36-year-old mother of three sons. She helps her husband in supporting the family financially by working in her mini-market. She is applying for this loan to help her bring more goods into the store and have a variety in what she sells.

loans.use: to bring more goods into the store

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia is a 33-year-old lady who works in a beauty salon. She also has a small evening and engagement dress showroom. She uses her connections from her full-time job as a hair dresser to market her private business in dress sales and rental. Now Alia wants to bring in a few more dresses and add selling bridal sets of make-up, and for that she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to bring in a few more dresses and bridal sets of make-up

loans.name: Nadina

texts.en: Nadine is a 33-year-old housewife and a mother of two boys. A few months ago she started a small business to help in adding another source of income for the family that can improve their living conditions. She started selling clothes and blankets. Now she is applying for this loan to increase the quantity she has of bed covers and bring in more winter clothing items for kids.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of bed covers and winter clothing for kids.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam is 43 years old and a housewife; her husband works in a clearance agency. She is applying for this loan to support her business which is blanket sales by bringing in more sizes of blankets and bed covers and different materials.

loans.use: to purchase more sizes of blankets for resale

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is a 40-year-old mother of 3 boys and a girl. While her husband is working as a driver during the day, Zainab feeds the goats and sheep they have. Her business is a livestock business and a dairy business as she sells the milk she gets from the goats. Now Zainab is applying for this loan to expand the number of goats she has to increase produced milk, and therefore increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase the number of goats in her herd

loans.name: Suha

texts.en: Suha is a 40-year-old housewife and a mother of six sons and daughters; two of them are married now. Suha is now starting a small business at home to help in improving their living conditions by adding another small source of income. She bought a few blankets as a test and found a good demand level among her friends and relatives. For that reason, Suha is applying for a loan to take advantage of the winter season and bring more blankets to sell and make more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more blankets

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis vive en orquídeas. Tiene37 años. Esta unido  tiene un  hijos. El toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante  seguir con los estudios de su hijo. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. El  decide juntar dinero para dar apertura  a su negocio de  soldadura en general  En la actualidad su ventas poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria Luis   trabaja diariamente solo. El  trabaja sin horario .Con el préstamo comprara  metales, soldadura, equipos necesarios, varios, etc. su meta es mejorar su negocio  y tener más maquinas
texts.en:
Luis lives in Orquídeas. He is 37 years old and has a live-in partner and one son. 

He made the decision to search for work to provide for his family, so that his son could continue with his studies. Since nobody gave him the opportunity to work in a company, he decided to save up to open his own general welding business. His sales have increased little by little, to the point where he now has the necessary clientele. Luis works alone every day, without a fixed schedule. 

With this loan, he will buy metal, solder, necessary equipment, etc. His goal is to improve his business and to have more machines.

loans.use: to buy metal, solder, and necessary equipment.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia tiene 36 años, convive con José, su esposo. Ambos tienen, 4 hijos, todos menores de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en una localidad rural.

Eulalia es una mujer  emprendedora, hace tan solo 7 años, que inició la siembra de maca, su producto bandera. Los que siembra en terrenos de la comunidad, que son alejados y hermosos. Primero, vendía su producción a los intermediarios que trasladaban sus cosechas a la ciudad de Junín, al ver que la maca que producía, era de buena calidad, hace 3 años que Eulalia, recibió la propuesta de vender su producción a una empresa procesadora de bebidas a base de maca en la capital, desde entonces comenzó su inversión en la mejora de la calidad de su producto, el cual le genera ganancias neta de 9 mil a 10 mil nuevos soles anuales. Por ello está planeando abrir su propia empresa de procesadora de maca, con el cual pueda expandir su negocio y por ende generar mejores ganancias, en corto plazo.
Por ahora lleva vende toda su producción a empresas que trasladan sus productos hasta la ciudad capital.
Ella requiere de su ayuda para iniciar otra siembra, que cosechará en 9 meses.
Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de San Pedro” y éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP, donde está segura de salir adelante junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal y agradece el apoyo recibido de parte de todos ustedes.
Eulalia; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la contrata de peones para que le ayuden en la siembra de maca, así también comprará semillas de ésta raíz nutritiva.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 36 and lives with her husband, José. They have four young children and live in their own home in a rural area.
Eulalia is an enterprising woman. She started cultivating maca, her banner crop, 7 years ago.  Maca is sown on remote and beautiful land throughout the community. In the beginning, Eulalia sold her produce to the intermediaries who would transport her harvest to the city of Junín. Three years ago, after seeing that her maca was high-quality, Eulalia was given an offer to sell to a company in the capital that makes drinks out of maca. With that, she began to invest in producing the highest-quality product. This generates her an annual net income of 9 to 10 thousand nuevos soles. Because of this, she is planning to open her own maca processing company. This will allow her to expand her company and generate a better income very soon.
At the moment, she still sells all of her produce to companies that transport it to the capital city.
She needs your help to sow a new crop, which she will harvest in nine months.
She belongs to the “Corazón de San Pedro” communal bank. She is sure to succeed with the other group members and is grateful for your support.
Eulalia will invest this loan in the hiring of labourers to help her sow maca. She will also buy seeds for this nutritious root plant.

loans.use: to hire labourers to help sow maca.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely tiene 50 años, está casada con José, de 54 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos; todos ellos mayores de edad. Ahora ella vive sola con su esposo en una casa propia ubicada en una localidad rural.
Nely es una mujer curiosa y emprendedora. Su distrito se caracteriza por ser artesanal. Hace 20 años que se dedica a la elaboración de tapices, mantas de lana, ponchos y demás tejidos a base de lana sintética y de algodón. Con el tiempo, dedicación y trabajo, logró abrir un puesto en la casa del artesano, que queda al lado de la municipalidad de su distrito, punto de encuentro de los turistas que llegan a la zona. Pero como mujer emprendedora ella, también tiene un carro, que hace trasporte público en las rutas de Tarma – Lima. Ahora Nely, está planeando viajar a diferentes ferias del país, donde puede expander su negocio.
Ahora se encuentra tejiendo chalinas y gorras para el frío, por ello necesita de su ayuda para adquirir más mercadería para continuar con su negocio. Éste es su tercer crédito con MFP MFP, y espera no defraudar el apoyo y confianza que le brinda su banco comunal “Corazón de San Pedro”, por ello se compromete en seguir adelante con los pagos puntuales.
Invertirá los 1000 soles solicitados en la compra de artesanía, para surtir su tienda y para adquirir más lanas de colores y así elaborar sus productos.
texts.en:
Nely is 50 years old, married to José who is 54 years old. They have three children, all of them adults. Now she and her husband live alone in their own home in a rural location.

Nely is a curious and enterprising woman. Her district is known for its handcrafted products. She has been working making tapestries, woolen blankets, ponchos and other weavings from synthetic wool and cotton. Over time by dedication and hard work she opened a stand in a craft shop, located next to the city in her district, a meeting place for tourists that visit the area. But as the enterprising woman she is, she also has a car she uses on the public transport between Tarma and Lima. Now Nely is planning to travel to different country fairs where she can expand her business.

She is knitting now scarves and hats for the cold, and so she needs help to acquire more merchandise in order to carry on with her business. This is her third loan through MFP and she expects not to let down the support and confidence offered to her by the communal bank Corazón de San Pedro, and she is committed to continue moving ahead with timely payments.

She will invest the 1000 soles she is requesting in the purchase of crafts, to supply her store and to buy more colored wool in order to create her crafts.

loans.use: to buy colored wool to make her crafts

loans.name: Kuncup Mekar Group

texts.en:
The group "Kuncup Mekar" was formed in 2005 and had 17 members. Over time, the group began to decrease and now only about 10 people are still active. This group has a wide variety of businesses such as catering for offices, corner grocers, clothes and bedspreads, household appliances, and selling snacks. Fellow members cooperate with each other, remind each other and support each other, which is why they have lasted for eight years. With a loan from Kiva, they are keen to grow their businesses, increase the types of foods they sell and add more equipment to increase efficiency.
The group is led by a woman named Lulu. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. Her husband works as a passenger boat driver part time. Lulu opened a catering service in her home. She works alone because she can’t afford to pay employees. Together with her husband, Lulu is trying to fulfill food orders from the offices she serves. With this loan, she will purchase cookware and a container to store cooked rice.
The woman in the purple scarf is a member of this group, but didn't borrow money in this loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy cookware and a container to store cooked rice

loans.name: Rosa Erlinda

texts.es: Doña rosa tiene a su esposo quien es jubilado le apoya, los dos hijos mayores le ayudan  económicamente, con esos ingresos paga los gastos del hogar teniendo también a su cargo al hijo menor de 7 años que estudia, ella vende productos en la ciudad de Rivas a dos horas de la capital, su crédito lo quiere para invertir en productos por catálogos como cosméticos, ropa, calzado por catalogo y nacional, piensa en un futuro mejorar su vivienda para lograrlo seguirá  invirtiendo en mas productos para aumentar su clientela.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa supports her husband who is retired. Her two grown children help out financially. With her income, Rosa is able to pay for the household expenses and also take care of her seven-year-old son who is in school.

Rosa sells products in the city of Rivas, which is two hours outside of the capital. Her loan will be invested in catalog products such as cosmetics, clothing, and shoes. She plans to make improvements to her home in the future. In order to accomplish this, she will continue to invest in more products so that she can increase her clientele.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, and shoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Mujeres Activas, esta en su primer ciclo, son 10 mujeres que desearon unirse para poder trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudar a sus hijos y familiares.
Una persona muy capaz y trabajadora es Selsa, quien es la presidenta de este grupo. Ella tiene una pequeña despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Comenta Selsa que su sueño es poder agrandar su despensa y el día de mañana poder tener un mini súper.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, lácteos, enlatados, verduras y demás, ya que con esto podrá surtir su negocio y seguir dado buenos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) is in its first loan cycle. There are 10 women who wanted to join together so that they could work as a group. By working in this manner, they will be able to help their children and family members.

One of these capable and hardworking individuals is Selsa, who is the group president. She has a small food pantry where she begins her work every day during the early morning hours. Selsa says that her dream is to expand her business until someday it becomes a mini-supermarket. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of beverages, dairy products, canned goods, vegetables, and other items. By restocking her business, she can continue to offer quality products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, canned goods, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 39 años, convive con Jesús, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Humberto y Jasmira. Su casa es propia y se ubica en un distrito rural.

María es ingeniosa y laboriosa, hace 10 años, abrió su tienda de venta de lanas, de diferentes colores, los cuales vende a los pobladores de su localidad, que se dedican al arte de tejer pendas de vestir, como también tapices. En su negocio le va muy bien, según menciona obtienen una ganancias neta de 300 soles semanales promedio. Pero como buena artesana, también se dedica a la venta de telares, que con mucho esfuerzo y creatividad teje, los cuales comercializa en el país de Ecuador, donde viaja 2 veces al mes. Además de aprovechar la temporada donde cosecha maca, que es una vez al año. Por ello más adelante está planeando surtir su negocio de tapices, con nuevos y variados dibujos, asimismo quiere innovar en el material de lanas.
Ella está entusiasmada en esta temporada de vacaciones y espera que los turistas la visiten, por ello requiere de su apoyo para adquirir más mercadería.
Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de San Pedro” y éste es su crédito número 10 con MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas.
María invertirá los 1000 soles solicitados en la compra de  varios fardos de lana de 35 kilos, que oscila entre 10 soles cada kilo. Con esto podrá tejer los hermosos telares que realiza.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old and lives with her husband, Jesús. They have 2 sons: Humberto and Jasmira. They have their own house situated in a rural district.

María is clever and hard-working. 10 years ago she opened her shop selling wool in different colours, which she sells to the inhabitants of the area who make clothes, or tapestries. The business is going very well for her, and she says they earn an average of 300 soles a week. But, as a good craftswoman, she also makes tapestries, which she weaves with a lot of effort and creativity. She sells them in Ecuador where she travels twice a month.

She also takes advantage of the season when she harvests maca, which is once a year. As this is coming up, she is planning to stock up her tapestry business with new and various designs, and she also wants to innovate with the wool. She is enthusiastic about the holiday season and hopes that the tourists visit her.

Because of this she needs your support to acquire more merchandise. She belongs to the "Corazón de San Pedro" and this is her 10th loan with MFP. She feels grateful for the help offered. She also promises to be punctual with her repayments. María will invest the 1000 soles she is asking for in buying various bundles of wool which are 35kg each, and cost around 10 soles per kg. With this she will be able to weave the beautiful tapestries she makes.

loans.use: to buy various bundles of wool.

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es:
Nelva tiene 37 años, está casada hace 15 años con Luis. Ambos tienen una hija, Guisel de 6 años a la que quieren y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en una localidad rural. Nelva una mujer carismática y de iniciativas; hace casi 2 años comenzó con el negocio de la venta de petróleo y gasolina, en la calle principal de su localidad, donde alquiló un pequeño espacio. Según cuenta vende un promedio de S/. 480 nuevos soles como máximo, ya que no existen muchos grifos en la zona. Además de aprovechar sus tiempos libres en tejer pequeñas gorras de lana, que comercializa a los intermediarios que la visitan constantemente. Pero su principal objetivo es consolidar su actividad de negocios. “A la semana me llega como 3 cilindros de gasolina y otros 2 de petróleo y si los vendo en esos 7 días, si me va bien”, menciona.
El negocio no para, ya que el tránsito de vehículos no se detiene, por esa razón requiere de su ayuda para adquirir más mercadería y continuar con éxito en el negocio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de san pedro” y éste es su crédito número 3 con MFP. Razón por la que promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
Nelva de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 4 cilindros de gasolina.
texts.en:
Nelva, age 37, has been married to Luis for 15 years.  They have a six year old daughter, Guisel.  They love her and are raising her in their own house, which is in a rural area.

Nelva is a charismatic woman with a lot of initiative.  Two years ago she started the business of selling oil and gasoline.  She does this on the main street in her area, where she rents a small space.  She says that she sells an average of S/. 480 soles at most because there are not a lot of pumps in the area.  

Also, she takes advantage of her free time to knit small woolen hats.  She sells the hats to intermediaries who continually visit her.  However, her main objective is to consolidate her business activities.  “In a week I get three cylinders of gas and another two of oil.  If I sell these in seven days, I am doing well,” she says.

The business does not stop because the vehicle traffic does not stop.  That is the reason she needs help to get more merchandise and to successfully continue in the business.  

She belongs to the Corazón de San Pedro communal bank.  This is her third loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  Upon receiving your support, Nelva will use the requested money to buy four cylinders of gasoline.

loans.use: to buy four cylinders of gasoline.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана занимается фермерством. У нее большой  опыт работы. За последний год она и ее муж имели серьезные проблемы со здоровьем, поэтому прибыль упала. Сейчас Оксана полна сил и очень хочет развивать бизнес.
Она просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20000 гривен для того чтобы провести газовое отопление в теплицах.  Перепады температур в теплице уменьшаться и растения будут расти лучше.  Соответственно увеличиться доход семьи.
texts.en:
Oksana is involved in farming and is very experienced in her work.  Last year, she and her husband had to face serious health problems, which caused their profits to fall.  Oksana is now completely healthy again and she is eager to develop her business.

Oksana is asking for a loan of 20,000 hryvnia in order to install a gas heating system in her greenhouses.  This will decrease variations in temperature inside the greenhouses and her cultures will grow better.  As a result, this will also help to increase the family's income.

loans.use: to install gas heating inside her greenhouses.

loans.name: Ma. Georgina

texts.en: Ma. Georgina is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old. Ma. Georgina is single. She buys and sells office and school supplies for a living. Ma. Georgina has been in her business for four years and earns 10,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Ma. Georgina joined GDMPC. Ma. Georgina is requesting a loan of 15,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase more papers and office supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more office supplies

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is from Gata Diot, Clarin. She is 56 years old. Leonora is married and has four children. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns about 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2012, she joined GDMPC. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She is from Maquilao, Tangub City. To make a living, Jessie grows bananas to sell, which she has been doing for 20 years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month. Jessie is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Jessie joined GDMPC in 2009. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizers

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita, 58, is from Pingcol, Ozamiz City. She is a widow and has three children. To earn a living, Nenita operates a tailoring business, providing general alterations and tailoring services. Nenita been in this business for three years and earns 3,500 PHP per month from the business. In 2012, Nenita joined GDMPC. Nenita is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is from Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and single. To make a living, Carmela owns and operates a vegetable production business. Carmela been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from this activity. Carmela is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

In 2009, Carmela joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Aldarmonh

texts.en: Aldarmonh is 27 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger in Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife Enhzaya works as a saleswoman in a local market. His son Monh-Ermuun goes to a local kindergarten. Aldarmonh attended a mobile phone repair course in 2008 and worked in a mobile phone repair center until now. He has gained a lot of experience and customers over the years. He is now starting his own business of mobile phone repair and sales at a rental counter of a local market. He is now requesting 1,350,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory and equipment for his newly starting business. He is a hardworking and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory and equipment for his newly starting business

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
This is Jovita. She previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and for her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jovita hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams for good health for all her loved ones. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lonito

texts.en: Lonito is from Guingona, Ozamiz City. He is 50 years old. Lonito is married and has six children. To make a living, Lonito owns and operates a gardening business. Lonito been engaged in his business for 12 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Lonito joined GDMPC. Lonito is requesting a loan of 7,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Jeoly

texts.en: Jeoly is married with six children. She is 36 years old and lives in Capucao, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jeoly owns and operates a plot of farmland, cultivating coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Jeoly been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2012. In the future, Jeoly's plan is to save her returns in order to pay for the renovation costs of her house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en: Erlita is from Guingona, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Erlita is a widow and has 2 children. Erlita raises coconuts. During harvests, she will produce copra, the dried meat of the coconut, then sell it. The coconut shells will be used to make charcoal. Erlita has been in her business for 25 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2012, Erlita joined GDMPC. Erlita is requesting a loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm chemicals. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband are continuously working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. She now sells frozen products for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of fabric, thread and other items for her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Delia dreams of being successful in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more thread and cloth for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 61, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is single and she lives with her relatives who she considers her family. At her age, she is working as hard as she can to provide income for her everyday needs and to help her family as well.

Erlinda operates a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda hopes to have a happy life and prays for more blessings for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: In

texts.en:
In, a 47-year-old mother of four children, is originally from a suburban area of Phnom Penh. She has her own house there where she has been living with her family for years. Being as a housewife, In serves her family with daily food and carries out the duties at home to assure a state of well-being for her family. Her husband and two sons are involved in the metalworking business to make living. They professionally produce gates, fences and steel doors or windows by welding them with their welding tools and equipment. Through hardships and a great passion for this work, In’s husband is able to generate at least 6.00 USD per day to support the family.

To help her husband and two sons in their metalworking business, In is seeking a loan that will help them to expand and buy iron, raw materials, and additional equipment, which they will use to improve the current business. In and her husband hope to have a larger workshop space and expand metalwork shop.

loans.use: to help her husband and two sons buy iron, raw materials, and additional equipment.

loans.name: Duurenbayar

texts.en:
Mr.Duurenbayar is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a ger (traditional Mongolian housing) in Hentii Province of Mongolia. His wife, Amarjargal, age 33, works in a local private company. His sons Monh-Erdene, age 14, and Monh-Orgil, age 8, go to a local school. 

Duurenbayar has been running a taxi service business for the last four years within the town. He is well known among the customers for his good and qualified service. 

He is now requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase insulation material for his ger in order to stay warm during winter. He is a hardworking and friendly man.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material for his ger in order to stay warm during winter.

loans.name: Naranbold

texts.en:
Mr. Naranbold is 32 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in Hentii Province, Mongolia.  His wife, Gantsetseg, works at a local hospital as a nurse.  His son, Eson-Erdene, attends a local primary school and his daughter, Esugen, is in kindergarten.  

Mr. Naranbold has been running a taxi service business in town since 2003.  He has gained a lot of experience and customers' trust over the years.  He is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to replace his car so that he may run his taxi service more smoothly without breaking down.  His car has had several breakdowns in the last few months.  He is a hardworking, diligent, and modest man.

loans.use: to replace his car in order to run his taxi service more smoothly.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 40-year-old mother and resident of Taguig, Philippines.  She is married to Joemer, an engineer.  She and her husband manage their household while operating a business.  At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Susana operates a junk shop.  Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines.  While waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials.  They sell these to junk shops for a small profit.  Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather large quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries such as factories.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP.  She will be incorporating this loan with her existing revolving fund that is used to buy recyclable materials from collectors.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business and she dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business.  She also draws strength and inspiration from their fellowship and from the Word of God that she studies.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, to and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials for resale.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Mr.Oyungerel is 27 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Hentii Province of Mongolia. His wife, Gandari, age 28, helps her husband to run his business of public transportation provider. His daughter, Pyundari, age 9, goes to a local primary school. 

Oyungerel has been running an inter-city transportation provider business since 2009. He has gained a lot of experience and strong customers over the years. 

Oyungerel is now requesting 3,600,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas-consuming minivan to provide his transportation business to local customers. He is a hardworking, enthusiastic and responsible person.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas-consuming minivan to provide his transportation business to local customers.

loans.name: Alfa

texts.en:
This is Alfa, 38, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Ronald, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Alfa operates an LPG business. What she basically does is buy liquefied petroleum gas tanks from wholesalers and sell them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size tanks. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Alfa hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of giving a good future to her family. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* family members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Norvin Aarón

texts.es:
El Joven Norvin Aarón es  casado padre de tres hijos y se dedica a la actividad de compra y venta de ropa usada, ya que esta actividad la ejerce desde hace 5 años teniendo buenos resultados en sus ventas, con la que ha desarrollado su familia llevando el sustento a su hogar. Cabe mencionar que es un joven muy entusiasta y con muchos deseos de superación.

Una de las necesidades que atraviesa es la de comprar ropa por pacas para satisfacer a su clientela en precios y calidad. 

Por eso acudió a  Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de ropa mixta para damas, caballeros, gorras, bolsos y zapatos para satisfacer la demanda y obtener los ingresos para realizar mejora en su vivienda y darle una mejor comodidad a su  familia.
texts.en:
The young man Norvin Aarón is married, the father of three children, and makes a living from the business of buying and selling used clothing. He has worked in this business for the last 5 years and had good results in his sales, supporting his family and maintaining his home on the business he has developed. It is worth mentioning that he is a very enthusiastic young man with a great desire to overcome obstacles.

One of the needs he is coming across is that of buying clothing in bales to satisfy his clientele in terms of prices and quality.

Because of this he went to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan to buy mixed clothing for women, men, caps, bags, and shoes to satisfy demand and to obtain the income to improve his home and make his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy and sell used clothing like caps and bags, a bale of shoes and a mixed bale.

loans.name: Dionisia Consuelo

texts.es:
La Señora Dionisia Consuelo  es  soltera  y se dedica a la actividad de compra y venta de granos básico en la ciudad de León, desde hace dieciocho años con la que ha desarrollado su familia llevando el sustento a su hogar. Cabe mencionar que es madre de madre de tres hijos menores que están bajo su responsabilidad, Sale de su casa de habitación a las 5:30 am, abre su negocio a las 6:00 am y finalizando sus labores a las 4:00 pm. Su negocio lo inicio con  aporte de su esposo.

El  crédito que está solicitando  a Ceprodel lo utilizara para comprar al  por mayor frijoles y especies  aprovechando de esta manera una oferta con precios rebajados. Esto permitirá ofrecerle a su clientela precios más accesibles,  así obteniendo mayores ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida tanto de ella como de su familia. 

Los sueños de Doña Dionisia es que sus hijos logren a coronar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Dionisia Consuelo is single and has made a living for 18 years buying and selling staples in the city of León.  She has supported and developed her family with this job.  It's worth mentioning that she's the mother of three minor children in her care.  She leaves the house at 5:30 a.m., opens her business at 6, and finishes work at 4 p.m.  She started her business with the help of her husband.

She'll use the loan she's requesting from CEPRODEL to buy beans and spices wholesale to take advantage of a sale with lower prices.  This will allow her to offer her customers more affordable prices, thus getting more income and improving her family's standard of living.

Dionisia's dream is for her children to manage to achieve a professional degree.

loans.use: to buy beans and spices

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Señora Angela  posee un negocio de venta de productos lácteos en la ciudad de León, desde hace trece años realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar. 

Ella sale de su casa de habitación 5:00 am iniciando a ofertar su producto a la 5:30 am finalizando a la 2:00 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a viernes,  inició su negocio con venta de marisco actualmente vende lácteo, es madre de siete  hijos  solo uno está  a su cargo.

Doña Angela  solicita un crédito a Ceprodel el que  utilizara en compra  queso duro por mayor  y mejor  calidad para obtener más ingresos y lograr un mejor nivel de vida de ella y su familia.  Ella sueña  que su negocio siga creciendo cada día más.
texts.en:
Angela has a business selling dairy products in the city of Leon. She has been doing this work for the last thirteen years to support her household.

She leaves her house at 5:00 a.m., starting to offer her product at 5:30 a.m. and finishing at 2:00 p.m., on this same schedule from Monday to Friday.   She started her business selling shellfish but now sells dairy. She is the mother of seven children but is only responsible for one.

Angela is asking for a loan from Ceprodel that she will use to buy better quality hard cheese wholesale to earn more income and achieve a better standard of living for her and her family. She dreams that her business will keep growing more and more each day.

loans.use: to buy hard cheese.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora, que gracias a su trabajo esta saliendo adelante y da a su familia todo lo que puede de acuerdo a sus posibilidades.
El es un cliente recurrente de Kiva, y cuenta que el crédito anterior le sirvió para poder surtir su negocio y seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes. Esta vez solicita nuevamente un crédito para volver  invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser azúcar, yerba, carbón, bebidas en general y otros insumos.
Esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo nuevamente, lo cual le sera de mucha ayuda a seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Mario is a very hardworking and enterprising person who's getting ahead thanks to his job.  He gives his family everything he can according to his possibilities.

He's a returning Kiva client.  He says the previous loan helped him be able to stock his business and continue giving his customers a wide variety.

This time he's requesting a loan to invest once again in buying supplies for his store, such as sugar, yerba mate, charcoal, beverages, and other supplies.

He's very grateful for the opportunity he's receiving again, which will be a big help to him to continue growing.

loans.use: To buy sugar, yerba mate, charcoal, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en la ciudad de León desde hace dieciocho años, inicia a ofertar su producto a las 5:00 am y finaliza a las 6 pm de lunes a domingo en este mismo horario, siendo  este trabajo el que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia. 

Leonardo  está solicitando este crédito para comprar Zanahoria, papa, banano, plátano, cebolla,  chayote  por mayor  y le permita tener más ingresos los que ayudaran a mejorar su negocio y su nivel de vida familiar.

Leonardo  es padres de cinco hijos,  solo tres  está a su cargo y sus sueños son  que su negocio siga creciendo cada día más para lograr  tener su propia vivienda ya que actualmente habita con sus padres.
texts.en: Leonardo has had a business selling fruits and vegetables in the city of Leon for the past 18 years. He offers his products from 5 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day of the week. This business is his family's sustenance. Leonardo is requesting the loan to purchase carrots, potatoes, bananas, onions and pears at wholesale, which will allow him to have more income to improve his business and his family's quality of life. He has five children, only three still under his care, and his dream is for his business to keep growing every day so he is able to have his own home, since he currently lives with his parents.

loans.use: to purchase carrots, potatoes, bananas, onions and pears.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos tiene 32 años de edad, es Soltero vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Ybycui. Cuenta que para  empezar con el negocio  recibió una ayuda de su papa, gracias a ello pudo montar una carnicería, gracias al empeño y el trabajo arduo sumados a la buena atención pudo ir creciendo rápidamente hoy en día ya cuenta  con clientela formada.
El préstamo solicitado será destinado para la compra de un congelador para la mejor conservación de sus productos. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la ayuda que está recibiendo ya que es una gran oportunidad para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 32 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the city of Ybycuí. He says that he received help from his father in order to start his business; thanks to this, he was able to set up a butcher shop. Owing to his determination and hard work, in addition to his attentiveness, it grew rapidly. Currently, he has a solid customer base. 

The requested loan will be put toward the purchase of a refrigerator for better conservation of his products. He is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the help that he has received, as this is an excellent opportunity for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for his business.

loans.name: Florterlita

texts.en:
Flortelita is 53 years old, married and has two children. She has managed a vegetable garden business for eight years and earns an income of 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

She became a member of GDMPC in 2008. She applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such a manure. Flortelita plans to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Lucia  se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, es un grupo muy numeroso que se ayudan las unas a las otras y están saliendo adelante juntas por medio de su trabajo.
Mercedes, quien es parte de este grupo es artesana, y también se dedica a la venta de quesos, es una persona que gracias a su trabajo ayuda a su familia y esta saliendo adelante. Su sueño es poder tener un gran negocio y seguir apoyando a los suyos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de queso, con lo que podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: The Santa Lucia group consists of a group of neighborhood women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. The group is very numerous because the members help each other and are making headway together through their work. Mercedes is a part of this group and is an artisan, and she also makes a living making cheeses. Thanks to her work, she is helping her family and making progress. Her dream is to have a big business and continue supporting her family. She is requesting the loan to be able to purchase cheese so she can meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cheese to sell.

loans.name: Dympna Divine

texts.en:
Dymna Divine is a 31 years old and single. She manages a motorcycle transport business and earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. She joined GDMPC in 2013. 

She wants a loan for 15,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to make improvements to her house from her business income.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a merchant from Nocnocan, Talibon. She has been running a sari-sari – variety store – business for more than 20 years. Gina works hard so that she can provide support to her husband in meeting her children’s needs, especially their schooling.

Gina is requesting a loan to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, rice, bread, snack foods, soda and beverages. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stock thus giving her the chance to cater more buyers at her store.

loans.use: buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, rice, bread, snack foods, soda and beverages

loans.name: Irehbayar

texts.en: Irehbayar is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in Ger in the Hentii province of Mongolia. Her husband Bayartuvshin, aged 37, is temporarily unemployed and taking care of their youngest son Azbayar, who is 1. Her daughter Azzaya and son Enhbayar, who are aged 17 and 13 respectively, go to the local secondary school. Irehbayar has been working as a tailor since 2004. She is now starting her own tailoring business in a rental place and requests 2,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory. She is a hardworking, optimistic and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her newly started tailoring business.

loans.name: José Benito

texts.es:
El Joven  José Benito, se dedica a la venta de calzado de forma ambulante en la ciudad de León desde hace veinticinco años, el realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia que está compuesta por su esposa y sus tres hijos. 

El Joven se traslada a su puesto de trabajo desde las 8:00 am y finaliza a las 3:00 pm. Labora de lunes a domingo  en este mismo horario.  El viaja a la ciudad de Managua dos veces por semana a comprar su mercadería.

José Benito se presento a  Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de zapato, gorra y fajas y así  satisfacer la demanda de su clientela donde obtendrá  los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, El sueña que sus hijos logren a coronar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
José Benito has worked selling footwear as an ambulatory vendor in the city of León for twenty-five years. He does this work to earn a living for his family, which is made up of his wife and their three children.

He goes to his job at 8:00 a.m. and finishes at 3:00 p.m. He works this same schedule from Monday to Sunday. He travels to the city of Managua two times per week to purchase his merchandise.

José Benito came to CEPRODEL to benefit from a loan in order to purchase shoes, caps, and belts, and in that way satisfy his customers’ demand, so he will obtain more income for the well-being of his family. He hopes that his children will complete a professional degree.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, belts, and caps.

loans.name: Garry Lou

texts.en: Garry Lou is 43 years old. His is married with 4 children. He has owned a motorcycle transport business for 5 years and gets an income of 5,000 PHP a month. He joined GDMPC in 2010. He wants a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase tyres and spare parts for motorcycle maintenance. He plans to purchase a new four-wheel vehicle to improve/expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase tyres and spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria, aged 49, is married with 3 children. She lives in Ozamis City. To earn a living she has been buying and selling vegetables for 7 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. She joined GDMPC in 2011. She has requested for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional vegetables to sell. She plans to make improvements to her house and business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lorenza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza del Socorro, tiene un negocio de ventas de refresco naturales y gaseosas, en uno de los  mercados de la ciudad de León desde hace dieciséis   años, inicia a preparar sus deliciosos  refrescos a las 6:00 en su casa posteriormente se traslada a su puesto de venta para su comercialización finalizando a las 5:00 pm. Es madre soltera de tres  hijos de los cuales solo dos están  a su cargo. 

El crédito que esta solicitado a Ceprodel será utilizado para comprar por mayor el producto para la elaboración de sus refresco tale como: azúcar, cacao, semilla, canela, cebada linaza, frutas variadas, y gaseosas, y así obtener mayores ingresos, los que le permitirán realizar  su sueños como es la mejora de  su vivienda  y así  brindarle una mayor comodidad a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Lorenza has been running a business selling natural refreshments and soft drinks in a market in the city of León for 16 years. She starts the preparation of her delicious refreshments in her home at 6:00 A.M. and then later takes them to her place of business to sell until 5:00 P.M. She is a single mother of three children of whom only two are under her custody. 
 
The loan that Lorenza is requesting from Ceprodel will be used to buy wholesale products to make her refreshments such as sugar, cocoa, seed, cinnamon, barley, flaxseed, mixed fruit, and soft drinks and so yield a greater income which will allow her to make her dream of improving her home and providing more comfort to her three children a reality.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cocoa, seed, cinnamon, barley, flaxseed, mixed fruit, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Kirov

texts.en:
Kirov is 57 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in Ger in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife Tseveendulam, age 45, helps her husband to run his business. His 2 sons Enhbaatar, age 22, and Erbold, age 21, and his daughter Buyanhishig, age 17, study at universities. 

The borrower has been working at a jewelry manufacturing company for years and has just started his own business of silver and golden jewelry redesign and producer in town. He is well-known in town and has a strong customer base. He is a hardworking and positive person. 

Kirov needs an additional 2,500,000  MNT to pay his children's tuition fees and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay his children's tuition fees and living expenses.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
As a widow parent of 5 children, Esther works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Esther is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her dried fish vending business.
