Esther has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 71 years old and has 11 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a business selling native products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Evelyn requested a loan of 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional native products to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional native products to sell.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en: Lida is married and works hard to support her family. She buys and resells vegetables and spices in the Philippines. Lida has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell. She has been in this business for 17 years now. In the future, Lida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Juan Vilma es madre soltera de cuatro hijos y se dedica a la venta de bisutería en la ciudad de León desde hace diez años, con la que ha desarrollado su familia llevando el sustento a su hogar, inicia a ofertar sus productos desde las 5 am y finaliza a las 3 pm. 

El crédito que esta solicitado a Ceprodel será utilizado para comprar producto de mejor calidad tales como piraña, diademas, chapas, cola, lápiz de ojos, vanidad, pinturas de uña y labio y así lograr mayores ventas para  obtener mas ingresos, los que le permitirán realizar  su sueño, como es la mejora de  su vivienda  y así  brindarle una mayor comodidad a sus cuatro  hijos.
texts.en:
Juana Vilma is a single mother with four children who has made a living selling costume jewelry in the city of León for 10 years.  She has supported her household and her family has flourished.  She begins selling at 5 a.m. and ends at 3 p.m.

She'll use the loan she's requesting from CEPRODEL to buy better-quality products such as hair clips, headbands, eye shadow, nail polish, lipstick, and other accessories.

This way she'll have greater sales and get more income, which will allow her to realize her dream of improving her home and giving her four children greater comfort.

loans.use: to buy hair accessories, eye shadow, nail polish, and lipstick

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité La Alegria  nace mediante la gestión de la Señora Virginia quien supo de este programa y unió a sus amigas y vecinas. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Virginia, es casada tiene 36 años, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y por sobre todo muy optimista e inculca a las integrantes de su comité a salir adelante.
Ella vende helados, y solicita de este crédito para la compra de mas helados, ya que estamos en la época de calor y es cuando más ventas tiene.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Alegria was born out of the initiative of Virginia who knew of this program and got her friends and neighbors to join together to form the group.  It is located in San Lorenzo City and its main goal is each member's individual growth.  The women are known locally for their commitment to their work.

Virginia, 36, is married, very enterprising and hard-working.  But above all else, she is optimistic and encourages the members of the group to strive to get ahead.

She sells ice cream and is requesting a loan to buy more of it because of the hot season, when demand increases.

loans.use: To buy ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la cuidad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación, se encuentran  en el 7mo ciclo,  y tienen como objetivo ayudarse las unas a las otras e ir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Margarita, ella tiene su kiosko, está casada con el señor Bernardo que trabaja de guardia de seguridad, tienen 3 hijos, y con el trabajo de ambos están saliendo adelante y dan a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin probaciones.
Cuenta la Sra. Margarita que solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, comestibles, golosinas, etc., con lo que podrá seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes. Agradece ella y su grupo por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de la fundación y de kiva.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnación and it cam about through the contact of one of its members with the Foundation.  It is in its seventh loan cycle and has the main goal of mutual help among the members as they strive to grow.

One of the members of the group is Margarita who runs a kiosk.  She is married to Bernardo who works as a security guard and they have three children.  With both incomes they are able to get ahead and provide a decent lifestyle for their children

Margarita says she is requesting the loan to buy beverages, food items, sweets, etc. so she can continue providing a wide variety of items to her customers.  She and the group are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving from the Foundation and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy beverages, food items, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry,  se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, están  trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 3° ciclo con 17 integrantes, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Una de estas mujeres trabajadoras es la Sra. Saida, quien vende prendas de variadas clases y marcas. Es una persona que siempre trata de innovar a sus clientes y les da todo lo que necesitan a un buen precio, es por eso que ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de jeans, remeras, shorts, musculosas y demás prendas. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le ayudara mucho.
texts.en:
Kuña Katupyry is the name of an excellent group of women in the city of Itá.  The 17-member group is happily and supportively working together in its third loan cycle within the program.

Saida, one of the members of the group, sells different kinds and brands of clothing.  She is someone who likes to be innovative, selling everything to her many customers at a good price.

She is requesting a loan to buy jeans, capris, shorts, sportswear and other clothing.  She is grateful for this opportunity because it will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: To buy jeans, capris, shorts, sportswear and other items to sale.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than several years now. This is the source of their income.

Hazel is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, flashlights and batteries as well as feed for the pigs. With this she will be able to improve their livelihood and generate more income. She hopes to make their business a success and to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, flashlights and batteries as well as feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Pedro Alfonso

texts.es:
La venta de granos básicos es el negocio que desarrolla el señor Pedro Alfonso en el departamento de León desde hace 12 años, inicia a ofertar su producto desde las 5:00 am  y finaliza a las 5:00 pm, siendo este trabajo el que le permite llevar el bienestar a su casa, 

El Señor Pedro está solicitando este crédito para  la comprar maíz y sorgo directamente a productores quienes le venden a precios más bajos y obtiene mayores ingresos los que ayudaran a mejorar su negocio y su nivel de vida familiar.

Don Pedro es padres de tres hijas,  solo una está a su cargo y sus sueños son  terminar de realizar mejora a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Pedro Alfonso has been selling basic grains in the department of León for 12 years.  He works from 5:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. in order to earn a living to provide for his household.

Pedro is requesting a loan to buy corn and sorghum directly from the producers who sell at lower prices.  This means he will earn a higher income to improve his business and family's lifestyle.

Pedro is the father of three daughters, one of whom is in his care.  His goal is to finish renovating his home.

loans.use: To buy corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña aracely es comerciante de ropa nueva y cosméticos en general, ella tiene 40 años de edad y con los ingresos que obtiene de su negocio contribuye a solventar algunas necesidades básicas de su hogar.
Necesita de un préstamo para ampliar su mercado y tener mayor cantidad de clientes lo que permitirá crecer como microempresaria.
Antes de tener la venta de ropa vendía carne de cerdo, por lo que hace seis años inicia con su nuevo negocio con proyecciones de crecer como comerciante.
Su actividad comercial lo inicia por esfuerzo propio y con el aporte económico de su esposo.
Su estado civil es casada y tiene cuatro hijas, todas en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Aracely sells new clothing and cosmetics in general.  She is 40 years old and uses the income from her business to help cover basic household expenses.

She needs a loan to expand her market and attract more customers so she can grow her small business.

She used to sell pork for a living, but started her clothes business six years ago with a plan to grow as a merchant.  She began on her own initiative with economic support from her husband.  She is married and has four school-aged daughters.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts and little boys' suits.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, she previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy sand, glue, patterns, plastics and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to continually provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy different products like sand, glue, patterns, plastics and other materials needed in her sand mosaic business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nenita dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give a good life to her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for sand, glue, patterns, plastics and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture-making business.

Edna has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from vegetable vending.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Doña rosa es comerciante de cosas de horno, producto alimenticio muy popular en los nicaragüenses, elaborado de maíz, queso y azúcar, y es producido con sus propias manos, además ella vende carne de cerdo en su casa de habitación.
Su negocio lo inicia con esfuerzo propio, esta labor lo aprendió desde joven, y desde entonces ha contribuido como un agente económico en su hogar y en su comunidad.
Sin embargo para mejorar su plan de negocios necesita de un préstamo para adquirir materia prima para producir las cosas de horno.
Su estado civil es casada y tiene tres hijos a su cargo, todos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a businesswoman who produces oven-baked food products that are very popular with Nicaraguans.  Made with corn, cheese and sugar, the product is made by hand.  In addition, Rosa also sells pig meat from her home.

She started her business with her own efforts, having learned to do this work from a young age.  Since then, she has contributed financially to her household and in her community.

However, to improve her business plan, she needs a loan to buy raw materials to produce her oven-goods.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are of school age.

loans.use: to buy pig's foot, corn, cheese and oil.

loans.name: Mayelqui Yahosca

texts.es:
Doña mayelqui tiene 23 años de edad, su negocio es la elaboración de tortillas, alimento producido de forma artesanal con sus propias manos.

Tiene cinco años de trabajar en este negocio y lo aprendió de su mama, quien también se dedica a esta labor.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para hacer realidad su plan de inversión que es para comprar maíz y leña y tener materia prima disponible para la fabricación de este alimento.

Ella inicia su negocio para apoyar económicamente a su hogar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
Su estado civil es casada y tiene un hijo de apenas dos años de edad
texts.en:
Mayelqui is 23 years old.  Her business is producing tortillas, a handmade food produced using traditional methods.

She has been doing this for five years, having learned from her mother who also does this for a living.  Mayelqui currently needs a loan to make her plan a reality.  She will invest in buying corn and firewood and to have the raw materials available to make this food.

Mayelqui started this business to support her household financially and to improve her living conditions.  She is married and has a son, who just turned two years old.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Lydia Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Lydia es comerciante de granos básicos y chiverías como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, entre otros.

Antes de tener su negocio atendía los quehaceres de su hogar, sin embargo se sintió motivada en contribuir económicamente a su familia, y ahora realiza la doble labor de atender a su hogar, vender granos básicos y chiverías.

Para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes, se proyecta en diversificar su línea de productos, y en esta ocasión necesita de un préstamo para hacer realidad su plan de negocios.
Ella es casada, y tiene una hija de 17 años que próximamente entrara a la universidad donde estudiara medicina.
texts.en:
Lydia is a shopkeeper.  She sells basic grains and dairy products, including rice, sugar, beans and oil.

Before starting her own business she took care of the household chores.  However, she was motivated to contribute to the household in financial terms and so now she does both - she looks after the house and also sells basic grains and dairy products.

In order to offer better service to her customers Lydia plans to diversify her range of stock.  On this occasion she needs a loan to put her plan into action.

Lydia is married.  She has a 17 year old daughter who will soon start studying medicine at university.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and dairy products.

loans.name: Aboudou

texts.fr:
Né vers 1960 à Zantièbougou, Aboudou vit avec ses 8 enfants et son épouse dans une famille monogame à Zantièbougou préfecture  de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas réussit à l’école très vite il s’est s'intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales qu’il achète auprès des paysans producteurs de Zantièbougou et environs.  
Aboudou, après avoir correctement remboursé ses 4 prêts précédents est à son cinquième  avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 tonnes de maïs. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant  et quelques fois à crédit, essentiellement à une clientèle composée  de revendeurs à Bamako. 
Aboudou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born towards 1960 in Zantièbougou, Aboudou lives with his wife and 8 children in a monogamous family environment in Zantièbougou, Bougouni prefecture. Having done poorly at school, he became interested in revenue-generating activities very quickly, notably the buying and selling of cereals, which he buys from the peasant farmers from Zantièbougou and the surrounding areas.

Aboudou, having properly repaid his 4 previous loans, is on his 5th loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy 2 tons of corn. He makes his sales for cash and occasionally credit, to a clientèle mainly composed of resellers from Bamako. Aboudou hopes to make a monthly profit of 70 000 francs, which will be used to meet his family's needs, to repay the the loan and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Né en 1966, Adama vit avec ses 6 enfants et son épouse dans une famille monogame au quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Adama, n’ayant pas réussit à l’école s’est très vite s’intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales qu’il achète auprès des paysans producteurs de Bougouni et environs.  
Adama  est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne mil et ½ tonne de niébé. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, dans le marché de Bougouni à une clientèle composée  d’hommes et de femmes. 
Adama  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 110.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1966, Adama lives with his wife and 6 children in a monogamous family environment in the district of Massablacoura, Bougouni town. Adama, having done poorly at school, quickly became interested in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of cereals, which he buys from the peasant farmers in Bougouni and the surrounding areas.

Adama is on his first loan from Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy 2 tons of corn, 1 ton of millet and half a ton of black eyed peas. He makes his sales at the Bougouni market for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle composed of men and women. Adama hopes to make a monthly profit of 110 000 francs, which will be used to meet his family's needs, to repay the the loan and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
Don José es vendedor de periódicos, su forma de venta es ambulante y de casa en casa, a sus 63 años cuenta con entusiasmo y energía, que lo caracteriza como una persona alegre y trabajador.
Necesita de un préstamo para ampliar su mercado, se proyecta abarcar más clientes, y poner otro vendedor que cubra su nueva ruta de venta.
Su actividad comercial lo inicia con esfuerzos propios, el se dedicaba a producir la tierra.
Su estado civil es casado y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en: José is a newspaper seller. He sells door-to-door and on the street. Aged 63, he is enthusiastic and energetic, making him a cheerful and hardworking person. He needs a loan to increase his customer base. He plans to reach more customers and employ another salesperson to cover his new sales route. His business activities are a result of his own efforts - he previously worked in agriculture. He is married with two children.

loans.use: to buy newspapers

loans.name: Marbelly Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña marbely tiene 24 años de edad, su negocio es la elaboración de tortillas, alimento producido de forma artesanal con sus propias manos.
Antes de tener su negocio era vendedora de cosas de horno y pan de casa en casa, sin embargo decidió dedicarse a este oficio.
Tiene dos años de trabajar en este negocio y lo aprendió de su mama, quien también se dedica a esta labor.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para hacer realidad su plan de inversión que es para comprar maíz y leña y tener materia prima disponible para la fabricación de este alimento.
Ella inicia su negocio para apoyar económicamente a su hogar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
Su estado civil es casada
texts.en:
Marbelly is 24 and has a tortilla business. She makes the tortillas herself with her own hands.
She used to sell bread and baked goods door-to-door but then she decided to make and sell tortillas.
She has been doing this work for two years and learnt from her mother, who also makes tortillas.
She currently needs a loan to implement her investment plan, which involves buying maize and firewood and having raw materials available to make tortillas.
She runs her business so she can support her household and improve her standard of living. She is married.

loans.use: to buy maize and firewood

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Né en 1974 à Bamako, Dramane vit avec ses 2 enfants et ses 2 épouses dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Heremakono de la ville de Bougouni. 
Dramane  en plus de ses activités professionnelles d’enseignant, s’intéresse aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales qu’il achète auprès des paysans producteurs de Sansola  et environs.  
Après avoir correctement remboursé les quatre prêts précédents,  Dramane  est à son cinquième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 3 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne et demi de mil. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, dans le marché de Bougouni à une clientèle composée  d’hommes et de femmes. 
Dramane  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1974 in Bamako, Dramane lives with his 2 children and his 2 wives in a traditional family setting in the district of Heremakono, Bougouni town. As well as having a professional career as a teacher, Dramane is interested in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of cereals, which he buys from the farmers of Sansola and the surrounding area.

Having properly repaid his 4 previous loans, Dramane is on his 5th loan from Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy 3 tons of corn and 1.5 tons of millet. He makes his sales at Bougouni market for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. Dramane hopes to make a monthly profit of 120 000 francs, which will be used to meet the family's needs, to repay the loan and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Nana Siata

texts.fr:
Née en 1984 à Tombouctou, Nana Siata vit avec ses 4 enfants et son époux dans une  famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Heremakono de la ville de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite elle s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment  à l’achat vente des habits, de tapis, des couvre lits et d’assiettes  en provenance de la Mauritanie.    
Nana Siata est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  2 douzaines de tapis et 5 cartons d’assiettes.  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile et en ambulant  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Nana Siata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1984 in Tombouctou, Nana Siata lives with her 4 children and her husband in a traditional family environment in the district of Heremakono, Bougouni town. Not having had the chance to progress with her studies, she quickly became interested in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of clothing, carpets, bedspreads and plates coming from Mauritania.

Nana Siata is on her 1st loan from Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy 2 dozen carpets and 5 boxes of plates. She makes her sales from her home and on the streets for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. Nana Siata hopes to make a monthly profit of 100 000 francs, which will be used to help her husband meet the family's needs, to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen carpets and 5 boxes of plates.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Née en 1978, Salimata vit avec ses 3 enfants et son époux dans une  famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Dougounina de la ville de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite elle s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment  à l’achat vente des habits de différentes sortes  en provenance de Bamako et des pagnes du Burkina.    
Salimata est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  50 pièces de pagnes auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile et en ambulant  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Salimata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1978, Salimata lives with her 3 children and her husband in a traditional family environment in the district of Dougounina, Bougouni town. Not having had the chance to progress with her studies, she very quickly became interested in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of different types of clothing from Bamako, and pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African fabric) from Burkina.

Salimata is on her 1st loan from Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy 50 bolts of pagnes from the wholesalers. She makes her sales from her home and on the streets for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. Salimata hopes to make a monthly profit of 90 000 francs, which will be used to help her husband meet the family's needs, to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena, es madre de cuatro hijos y se dedica a la venta de bisutería de forma ambulante en las calle de la ciudad de León desde hace quince años, con la que ha desarrollado su familia llevando el sustento a su hogar, inicia a ofertar sus productos desde las 6 am y finaliza a las 3 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a domingo.

El crédito que esta solicitado a Ceprodel será utilizado para comprar producto de mejor calidad tales como piraña, diademas, chapas, cola, lápiz de ojos, vanidad, pinturas de uña y labio y así lograr mayores ventas para  obtener más ingresos, los que le permitirán realizar  su sueño, como es  lograr a  tener su propia vivienda ya que actualmente habita en casa de un familiar.
texts.en:
María Elena is the mother of four children and has worked selling miscellaneous goods on the streets of León for 15 years. She has done this to sustain her family and support her household. She begins work at 6am and finishes at 3pm every day, Monday to Sunday.

The loan she is requesting from Ceprodel will be used to buy better quality products like hairclips, hairbands, sole protectors, eye makeup, eyeliners, pocket mirrors, nail polish and lipstick so that she can achieve more sales and earn more money. She would like to achieve her dream of having her own home, as she currently lives with relatives.

loans.use: to buy  hairclips, hairbands, sole protectors, eye makeup, eyeliners, pocket mirrors, nail polish and lipstick

loans.name: Ruhiddin

texts.ru: Рухиддину 23 года. Он остроумный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Рухиддин еще не женился и живет с родителями. Рухиддин успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Данное время он является студентом 3 курса Славянского Государственного Университета Таджикистана по специальности Международное Отношения. Рухиддин очень способный и общительный молодой человек, и поэтому все его друзья и учителя уважают его. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но его родители не имеют денег. Его мать торгует на местном рынке и ели-ели обеспечивает семью. Рухиддин запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ruhiddin is 23 years old. He is a smart and hardworking young man. Ruhiddin has not yet married and lives with his parents. 

Ruhiddin successfully finished high school and started university. Currently he is a third year student in International Relations at the Tajik Slavonic State University. Ruhiddin is a very capable and sociable young man, and therefore all his friends and teachers respect him. He has to pay tuition, but his parents do not have money. His mother trades at the local market and can barely provide for the family. 

Ruhiddin requests a loan in the amount of 1,000 US dollars to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Umsunai

texts.ru: Умсунай 50 лет, замужем, воспитала 2 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, в 1992 году Умсунай начала свой бизнес в садоводстве и животноводстве.  Также, в связи с тем, что Умсунай по образованию швея, она занимается пошивом национальных изделий, что приносит небольшой доход в корзину семьи.Начатое со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) ,бизнес на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи изготовленных собственноручно изделий . В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Умсунай обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку тканей и материалов для шитья, для увеличения оборота бизнеса. Доходы Умсунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Umsunai is 50 years old, married and has raised two children. In search of a source of income for the family, Umsunai started her business of gardening and animal husbandry in 1992. Further, as Umsunai is a seamstress by education, she works with sewing national clothing, which brings in a small income to the family. Having started with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS) the business currently brings in around 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of handmade products. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Umsunai turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of fabrics and materials for sewing, to increase the turnover of the business. Umsunai plans to invest the income in further expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for producing national clothing

loans.name: Madinakhon

texts.ru: Мадинахону 28 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Мадинахон трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Она всегда в поиске знаний и инновации и поэтому она поступила в университет с целью получения высшего образования. Данное время она является студенткой 4 курса Худжандского Государственного Университета по специальности Бухгалтерский учет и аудит. Мадинахон активно участвует в студенческой жизни университета и после занятий шьет национальные женские платья. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег для этого. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Madinakhon is 28 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Madinakhon is a hardworking and purposeful woman. She is always in search of knowledge and innovation and therefore she started university with in order to receive higher education. Currently she is a fourth year student in accounting and auditing at the Khujand State University. 

Madinakhon actively takes part in the student life of the university and after works with sewing women's national clothing. She must pay for the tuition, but she does not have money for this. She requests a loan to pay for university tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the business for more than seven years now. Fishing is the source of his income.

Jesus is asking for a loan to buy to buy materials for fishing such as nets, hooks, lead weights and other items. With this loan, he will be able to increase his catch thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market. Jesus hopes to make his business a success so that he will be able to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing such as nets, hooks, lead weights and other items.

loans.name: Hayitgul

texts.ru:
Хайитгулу 57 лет. Она вдова и имеет 1 сына.  После смерти мужа она осталась без кормился. Ей пришлось заниматься выращиванием сельхоз культуры для получения дохода.  Ее сын женился и имеет 4 детей. Хайитгул очень любит своих внуков, и она старается, чтобы ее внуки росли хорошей условий и получили образованию.  Она хочет организовать новый бизнес для получения дополнительного дохода. 
 С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей скота.  От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hayitgul is 57 years old. She is a widow and has one son. After her husband died she was left without food. She had to engage in the cultivation of agricultural crops to get income. Her son is married and has four children. Hayitgul very much loves her grandchildren, and she strives for her grandchildren to grow up in good conditions and receive education. 

Hayitgul would like to set up a new business to get additional income. With this aim she attended the course "Achieve success", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received a certificate. Currently she is fully able to organize her own business and become successful in this area. She would like to set up a business of buying and reselling livestock. From the income received she plans to improve her living conditions. 

Hayitgul requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni for the purchase of livestock, in order to set up the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy livestock for organizing a new business

loans.name: Ma. Melodie

texts.en:
Ma. Melodie is married with 4 children, 2 of them are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Melodie has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. Ma. Melodie requested a PHP 29500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

Ma. Melodie has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Ma. Melodie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир успешно вложил предыдущий кредит от КИВА в свой фермерский бизнес. Он закупил качественные семена и удобрения, построил новую большую теплицу для выращивания помидор, а также теплицу для рассады за это время, за счет чего смог увеличиться и доход . 
В этот раз Владимиру понадобилась дополнительная сумма в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена, пленку и удобрения для нового сезона. Зимой и весной тяжело с деньгами и для того, чтобы купить качественные семена приходится брать кредит. Более того Владимир планирует накрыть новую теплицу для рассады и завезти туда грунт и торф.
texts.en:
Vladimir successfully invested the previous loan from Kiva in his farming business. He purchased quality seeds and fertilizers, built a new greenhouse for growing tomatoes, and further a greenhouse for seedlings for this time, and due to this he was able to increase his income. 

This time Vladimir needs an additional sum in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia in order to purchase seeds, plastic film and fertilizers for the new season. The winter and spring is hard with money, and in order to buy quality seeds he needs to take a loan. In addition, Vladimir plans to cover new greenhouses for seedlings and bring in soil and peat.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic film and fertilizer for the new season

loans.name: Saba Group

texts.en:
This group is called Saba which consists of 3 ladies and man who live in Taiz, Yemen. Saba is the leader of this group. She is 25 years old, married and has one child. 

Saba owns a small house and started to buy a small piece of land. She is a hardworking woman who dreams of providing her child with a better future. She intends to renovate her house. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials to use for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to use for her house.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.ru:
Ашот использовал средства, полученные от КИВА в прошлый раз для того, чтобы подготовить свои теплицы к новому сезону, так как весной всегда не хватает денег на самое необходимое. Благодаря полученной прибыли Ашот смог позволить себе сделать ремонт в доме и приобрести машину. 
В этот раз Ашот обратился к КИВА за финансовой помощью в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести пленку перекрыть теплицы, сделав в них ремонт и установив хорошее отопление, а также закупить горшочки для рассады и навоз в качестве удобрений, тем самым хорошо подготовиться к высадке рассады.
texts.en:
Ashot used the resources received from Kiva the previous time to prepare his greenhouses for the new season, as there is never enough money for all the necessary things in the spring. Thanks to the income received, Ashot was able to allow himself to repair his home and purchase a car. 

This time Ashot turned to Kiva for financial support in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia for purchasing plastic film to cover the greenhouses, repairing them and installing good heating, and further to purchase pots for seedlings and manure as fertilizer, thus being well prepared for planting.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film for the greenhouses, repairing them and installing good heating and further to purchase pots for seedlings and manure as fertilizer

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en: Ms. Imtiaz is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of selling bags for the last one year. She purchases different bags in bulk at wholesale rates and then offers them to the people of her community. She makes enough from this business to fulfill the needs of the family members. She has five children; two of them are school going. In order to cater to more customers, she needs to purchase more handbags in different colors and designs by taking in account the demands of her customers. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. She expects a boost in her earnings through her large sales and desires to spend the part of it on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more handbags in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 45 лет. Она замужем на доброго человека, которого зовут Фаррух. Ее муж предоставляет услуги мастера по евроремонту. Назира имеет 3 детей. Двое детей Назиры учатся в средней школе, а старший ее сын учится в университете.  Назира более 21 года работает учительницей в средней школе. Она преподает математику  и физику. Назира имеет хорошую специфику и является мастером своего дела. Каждый месяц она получает 880 сомони заработанную плату. Назира и ее муж стараются, чтобы их дети получили хорошую образованию и будущим стали хорошими специалистами. Назира не имеет денег для оплаты своего сына в университете и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nazira is 45 years old. She is married to a good man, who is called Farrukh. Her husband provides a renovation service. Nazira has three children. Two of Nazira's children go to high school, and her eldest son studies at the university. 

Nazira has worked as a teacher in high school for more than 21 years. She teaches mathematics and physics. Nazira is educated for her job and has a good specialization. Every month she receives 880 somoni in salary. 

Nazira and her husband strive for their children to receive a good education and become specialists in the future. Nazira does not have enough money to pay for her son at the university and therefore she requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni for the tuition of her son. She awaits you kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s education

loans.name: Eva Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Eva Mercedes, es madre de cuatro hijos y se dedica a la venta de bisutería en uno de los mercado de la ciudad de León desde hace doce años, este trabajo lo realiza para llevar el sustento a su familia, sale de su casa a las 5:00 y abre su negocio a las 5:30 am finalizando hasta las 5:00 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a sábado.

El crédito que esta solicitado a Ceprodel será utilizado para gastos de matriculas y aranceles de universidad de su hijo que está a su cargo.

Doña Eva espera que su sueño se le cumpla en ver a su hijo coronar  su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Eva Mercedes is the mother of four children and has made a living selling miscellaneous goods in the market in the city of Leon for the past 12 years. She carries out this job in order to provide for her family. She leaves the house at 5 a.m. and opens her business at 5:30 a.m., finishing at 5 p.m. every day from Monday to Saturday.

The loan she is requesting from Ceprodel will be used to pay for university fees and registration for her son who is under her care.

Eva hopes that she can see her dream of her son achieving a professional career fulfilled.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Bilakoro Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Bilakoro  est constitué de 7 femmes mariées et 2 veuves qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Niebala de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de cosmétiques, de charbon de bois, de tasses, du savon, des condiments et des articles divers. 
Souadou, qui est la seule assise devant, fait l’achat vente de condiments.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 sacs d’oignon, 1 carton de cube maggi, 1 sac de sel, 1 carton de concentrée de tomate et un colis de divers condiments (aubergines, ail, choux et poivre) avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités, pour les frais de santé et rembourser le prêt.
NB/ MAMINE est absente de la photo pour raison de santé.
texts.en:
The Bilakoro group is made up of 7 married women and 2 widows who have an average age of 41 and, on average, 4 children. They mainly live in traditional family environments in the district of Niebala, Bougouni town. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly relationships, friendship and business. The group joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better run their businesses, and they are on their 2nd loan. The group members sell beauty products, charcoal, cups, soap, condiments and various other items.

Souadou (the woman sitting in the front in the picture) sells condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 bags of onions, 1 box of Maggi stock cubes, 1 bag of salt, 1 box of tomato concentrate and a package of various condiments (aubergines, garlic, cabbage and pepper) from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and from her home, for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of healthcare expenses and repay the loan.

Note: Mamine, a group member, could not be in the picture because of health reasons.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Soutoura  est constitué de 4 femmes mariées et 2 veuves qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Niebala de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de cosmétiques, de céréales, du bois de chauffe, du savon,  des articles divers et de la restauration. 
Habi, qui est la seule assise devant, fait l’achat vente des articles divers.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1  colis de condiments alimentaires (poivre, ail, oignon, gombo séché, sel, cube maggi, potasse et feuilles séchés de baobab)  et 2 sacs d’arachide avec les grossistes et dans les villages voisins de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités, pour les frais de santé et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Soutoura group is made up of 4 married women and 2 widows who have an average age of 30 and, on average, 4 children. They mainly live in traditional family environments in the Niebala district of Bougouni town. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly relationships, friendship and business. The group joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better run their businesses, and are on their 2nd loan. The group members sell beauty products, cereals, charcoal, soap, prepared food and various other items.

Habi (the woman sitting in front in the picture) sells various items. She plans to use her loan to buy 1 package of food condiments (peppers, garlic, onions, dried gumbo, salt, Maggi stock cubes, potash and dried baobab tree leaves) and 2 bags of groundnuts from the wholesalers and in Bougouni's neighbouring villages. She makes her sales at the market and from her home, for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of healthcare expenses and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy 1 package of food condiments and 2 bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Verónica Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Verónica Isabel,  tiene un negocio de venta de carne en baho y chancho con yuca, desde hace veintiún años inicia a prepararlo en su casa  desde las 2:00 am  y se traslada a las 7:00 am  a uno de los mercado de la ciudad de León  para su comercialización finalizando a las 2:00 pm de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario, siendo  este trabajo el que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia, es madre de dos  hijas. 

Doña Verónica se presento a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para ser utilizado en pago de matriculas, compra de uniformes y útiles escolares de sus dos hijas, y sueña con que logre a coronar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Veronica Isabel has has a business selling meat in and pork with yucca for 21 years. She starts preparing it in her house at 2 a.m. and at 7 a.m. she travels to one of the markets in the city of Leon to sell her products, finishing at 2 p.m. She follows this timetable from Monday to Saturday as this job allows her to provide for her family; she is mother to two daughters.

Veronica has requested a loan from Ceprodel to pay for the school registration, uniforms and other school items for her daughters and she dreams that they may be able to crown their career.

loans.use: to pay for school registration, to buy a uniform and other school items.

loans.name: Ma. Ruth

texts.en: Ma. Ruth is 55 years old and lives in La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married, has 4 children and earns a living by running a general store. She has been in this business for 6 years and earns 6,000 PHP per month. She joined GDMPC in 2010 and is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee for her store.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
La Joven Melania es madre soltera  y   trabaja  en un centro hospitalario de la Ciudad de León,   la Joven  sale de su casa de habitación 6:30 inicia sus labores 7:00 am  finalizando  a las 3:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes, realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a sus  tres  hijos. 

La Joven solicita un crédito a Ceprodel  el que será  utilizado   para pago de matrícula, arancele y compra de útiles escolares, ya que ella sueña ver a sus tres hijos con una carrera profesional y así  logren un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Young Melania is a single mother who works in a medical centre in the city of Leon. Se leaves her house at 6:30 a.m., starts work at 7 a.m. and finishes at 3 p.m. every day from Monday to Friday. She does this in order to provide for her three children.

Melania is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to pay for the school registration, fees and other school items of her children as she dreams of seeing them with a professional career and achieving a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for school registration, fees and other school items.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Balimaya, composé de femmes mariées et une célibataire, ont en moyenne 28 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce habillements, de l’arachide, du charbon de bois et des boissons.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Balimaya sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente KADIA, première personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter deux cartons de mèche, trois cartons de pommade, quatre cartons de parfums, une dizaine de prêt-à-porter pour homme et des draps avec les fournisseurs de Cotonou et du Burkina pour ensuite vendre dans sa boutique et à la maison au niveau de Fana.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins (achat de trousseaux de mariage et parures) et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’habillements.
texts.en:
The Balimaya group is made up of married women and one single woman with an average age of 28 and, on average, 3 children and who all live in extended, traditional family settings in the town of Fana, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and friendship. They sell clothing, groundnuts, charcoal and drinks. The women of the Balimaya group are on their 6th group loan.

Kadia (first on the left in the picture) plans to buy 2 boxes of hair extensions, 3 boxes of creams, 4 boxes of perfumes, a dozen ready to wear outfits for men and some bed sheets from the suppliers of Cotonou and Burkina, so that she can resell the items in her shop and from her home in Fana. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 75 000 francs, which will be used for her needs (to buy a wedding outfit and matching jewellery). Part of it will also be reinvested in her clothing business.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of hair extensions, 3 boxes of creams, 4 boxes of perfumes, a dozen ready to wear clothes for men, and bed sheets.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 47 years old and married with 2 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing 22000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been raising pigs for 18 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en: Melchora's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 37 years old, married and has 2 children. She is from Camp 1, Aurora and has been farming for 5 years, earning an amount of 8,000 a month. Recently, Melchora joined GDMPC. Melchora is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next growing season. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next growing season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more durian to resell.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Ms. Irshad is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various goods for daily use at reasonable prices. She has good communication skills and holds a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Irshad makes enough to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy stocks of rice, grains, and flour from the market at lower rates. She then will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with the educational expenses of her children and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, grains, and flour at lower rates from the market.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 51-years-old, and married with seven children. Her husband works as a farmer, while she manages her food selling business (house-to-house basis). She has been in her business for almost three years. At this time, Elena is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 to buy vegetables, fruits, native cakes, and "tinapa" (smoked fish) to sell. Elena hopes to grow her business and earn a higher income to lift her family from poor living standards.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, native cakes, and "tinapa" (smoked fish) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits to resell.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her business.

Virgie has been in this business for four years. Virgie earns additional income from raising livestock.

Virgie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is a mother of seven grown up children. Josephine has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for several years now. This has been the source of their income. 

Josephine needs a loan to improve their business. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks and other items. With this loan, her husband will be able to catch more, thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market.

In the future, Josephine hopes to expand their business to augment their revenue.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her business. Pacita has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from raising pigs. Pacita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en: Anselma plants, harvests, and sells corn to make a living. She is from Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 51 years old, married, and has 10 children. Anselma been in the farming business for 26 years and earns PHP 10,000 a month. In 2011, Anselma joined GDMPC. Anselma is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for her farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 32-year-old widow who is blessed with two children, ages 12 and 8, whom she supports. She owns a beauty salon and has been in business for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000.

Florence is now servicing her fourth loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, after she successfully repaid the previous loans. She intends to use this loan to pay the school fees for her children. 

The profits she earns will be used to reinvest in her business and pay the school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and also educate her children at higher levels.

loans.use: To reinvest in her beauty salon business and to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has 6 children and has been doing this work for 15 years. Her primary income sources are the sales of milk, eggs and crops, which is her personal business.

She stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is "tending to crops and watching them flower!" Her biggest challenge is "getting water during the dry seasons" for her crops and animals. She has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow.

Leah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "I heard about Juhudi from a Juhudi officer."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. She replied, "I learned about record keeping and group leaderships."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Leah replied, "My asset base will increase and I will be able to take my kids to school."



As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Leah owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

loans.name: Luuzedmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Luuzedmaa is 34 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a ger (traditional Mongolian tent) in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Rentsendorj, runs a transportation service business. Her daughter, Altanzul, age 10, and son, Altanbagana, age 6, study at a local primary school. 

Luuzedmaa has been working part-time at a private shoe manufacturing company since 2010, and she also manufactured seasonal shoe products at home during that time. She is now starting her own cobbler business at home and is requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory to start her own cobbler business. She is a hardworking and clever woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory to start her own cobbler business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to pay for spare parts, accessories and the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and maintain her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marites hopes to give her children a good quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance, spare parts, and accessories for her tricycle.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband are working hand in hand to continuously provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and other supplies, such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Josefina dreams of growing her business in the coming years and hopes to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening supplies and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en: Shadrack is now 32 years old and he is requesting a fourth loan to purchase a third motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profit to start up a greengrocery business for his wife. His previous loans were paid successfully. He hopes to prosper in his family life.

loans.use: to purchase an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 38, is married and has 4 children. She is from Ozamis City. She has cultivated bananas to sell for 8 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. She joined GDMPC in 2011. She has requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She dreams of renovating her house one day.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is married with 2 children. She is 53 years old and lives in Ozamiz City.

Agapita is managing a sari-sari (general) store business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years and every month she earns 10,000 PHP from this business. She has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. Agapita has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years. In the future, Agapita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tools for repairing damaged refrigerators.

loans.name: Francisco Rafael

texts.es:
Francisco con su anterior credikiva compró una  placa madre (motherboard), el elemento principal con el cual mejoró totalmente su ordenador; hoy está muy entusiasmado con sus resultados pues hay mas efectividad en su negocio y por eso está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual actualizará sus monitores para completar su estrategia de mejoramiento permanente en sus herramientas de trabajo, para lograr una mejor presentación de su negocio.
Francisco dice a los financiadores de Kiva “ Un agradecimiento especial porque con su ayuda están contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco used his previous Kiva loan to buy a ‘placa madre’ (motherboard).  This is the primary component that he used to completely improve his computer.  He is now very enthusiastic about his results.  

His business is more effective, and that is why he is requesting a new Kiva loan.  He will use the loan to update his monitors.  He will do this to complete his plan of continuous improvement of his work tools.  This way he will manage for his business to have a better appearance.

Francisco tells the Kiva lenders, “A special thank you because with your help you are contributing to the growth of my business.”

loans.use: to update his monitors.

loans.name: D, D, C. Group

texts.en:
Alex, who is in his early 30s, is married with one small child. He has been a tailor since 2005. He works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be his 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a mattress, another sewing machine, fabrics, a TV set, and to cover household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a new loan to buy more sewing equipment. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Alex will share this loan with his loan group "DDC", which has 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sewing equipment.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 47-year-old widow who owns rental houses in Ujamaa Likoni Mombasa. She has been in this business for the past 12 years and has done well. 

Her monthly income is great and she is requesting her second loan after paying the first one successfully. The loan will help her renovate her rental houses, and she will use the anticipated income to repay her loan and enter into a new venture. 

She hopes to continue with KADET LTD for further development of her undeveloped land.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. She has 1 child and has been doing this work for 4 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "She enjoys seeing her cows feeding and crops growing!" Her biggest challenge is: "Diseases which really cause a lot of losses." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "brown and black headed." 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy a dairy cow.

Everlyne was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Got the news from a nearby group."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "She learned about poultry and dairy keeping for income generation."

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?", Everlyne replied "Her asset base has really improved and she will be able to feed her family well."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Everlyne owns the following: "cow, poultry, pump, bicycle" but does not own "pig, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a "mosquito net" but does not have "electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old, married and has 5 children.

Pablito raises coconut. During harvests, he will produce copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) then sell it. The coconut shells will be used in charcoal making. Pablito has been in his business for 20 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Pablito joined GDMPC. Pablito is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm chemicals. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 29 years old, married and blessed with two children that she supports. She has run a general store specializing in household items for the last two years, making a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

With her first loan of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd., she plans to get more food items like sugar and cooking flour to sell. The anticipated profits will help educate her children. 

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food  items like sugar and cooking flour for her shop.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 73 years old and married. She has eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marietta runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years and also earns an income from food sales. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, spices, soap, sugar, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store.

In the future, Marietta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks like canned goods, spices, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Kayira Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kayira, composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 49 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, d’habillements, de riz et font la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Kayira sont à leur quatorzième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                           
La cliente WAH, la personne au milieu, compte acheter deux sacs d’échalotes, deux sacs d’oignons, un carton de soumbala, 10Kg de poudre de gombo, deux cartons de poissons fumé, deux bidons d’huile de 20litres et 1 sac de 25Kg de sel avec les fournisseurs de Bamako  pour ensuite vendre sur place à la maison au niveau de Fana.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The members of the group Kayira are married women and widows who average 49 years of age and five children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the city of Fana, region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other as neighbors and through ties of kinship and friendship. They sell condiments, clothing, and rice, and they also run restaurant services. 

This is their 14th group loan cycle. WAH, standing in the middle of the group, plans to use her loan to buy two bags of scallions, two bags of onions, one carton of soumbala (a condiment made from néré seeds), 10 kg of gumbo powder, two cartons of smoked fish, two 20-liter containers of oil, and one 25 kg bag of salt from Bamako suppliers for resale from her home in Fana.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 90,000FCFA that she will use to provide for her family’s needs. A portion will be reinvested in her condiment sale activity.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.fr: la cliente Desange est présidente du groupe Nuru, âgée de 33 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants qui étudient. La cliente est couturière-modéliste et sociétaire d’un atelier de coupe-couture. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans cette entreprise. Elle a commencé son activité  vers 2002 avec son fond propre, plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF-Hekima. Elle installe son atelier au le marché central de Virunga. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner avec de tissus dames, tissus pour confection veste pour hommes, boutons, mordoré, popeline,etc. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler, qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Desange, the customer, is the leader of the Nuru group. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of 3 children who go to school. She is a dressmaker and a member of a dressmaking and sewing workshop. She works together with her husband in this business. She started her business around 2002 with her own money and later received credit from MFI Hekima. She set up her workshop at the Virunga central market. This new loan should enable her to restock on fabric for women's clothing, fabric with which to make men's vests, golden brown buttons, poplin and other items. The customer thanks Hekima for its actions in aid of poor women excluded from regular banks.

Note: in the picture, one of the customers is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy fabric for women's clothing, fabric with which to make men's vests, golden brown buttons, poplin, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, 42 años de edad, originario de Managua, casada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 16, 21 y 23 años, actualmente dos están estudiando y el tercero vive independiente y trabaja por cuenta propia , de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada.  Inicio su actividad laboral  hace 4 años con capital propio, dinero que le dieron de su liquidación de su anterior  trabajo, lo que decidió invertirlo en el negocio de pulpería, la cual la cerro por falta de tiempo, actualmente se dedica a vender ropa usada de forma ambulante, cuenta con el apoyo de su mama y  de su hija.
Ella solicita el financiamiento para comprar ropa como blusas, vestidos, pantalones, faldas, etc. Ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar toda la mercadería en general para aprovechar la temporada de venta, la cual le ayudaría a crecer en clientela, sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura del local.
texts.en:
Blanca is 42 years old. She is originally from Managua and is married with three children, ages 16, 21, and 23. Two of her children are currently studying, and the third lives independently and is self-employed.

Blanca is a saleswoman who makes a living selling used clothing. She started her own business four years ago with her own capital, the severance pay from her old job. She decided to invest this money in a stationery shop, which she later closed because she did not have enough time for the business. She now sells used clothing as a traveling saleswoman, with the support of her mother and her daughter.

She has applied for financing to buy clothing such as shirts, dresses, pants, skirts, etc. She estimates that this loan will help her to buy the general merchandise she needs to take advantage of the sales season, which will help her to grow her clientele. Her plan for the future is to improve the infrastructure of her business premises.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as shirts, dresses, pants, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic.  She previously accessed a loan that helped her a lot in her business and family. Her variety store is continuously growing. She and her husband work hard together to sustain their business and family needs. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marivic dreams to give a good life to her family and hopes that her business will grow even more. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Phoebe Cates

texts.en:
